Maybe eating at the restaurant would have given me a different / better experience. I just wouldn't order takeout if I were you.
The soul rolls were really good as was the salmon cakes and yams.  Our party of six (two kids) really enjoyed Mert's.

The service was not as good as it should have been. Ordered catfish and wings but only received wings. Asked for sweet tea 3 times. When I finally got it I loved it. The chicken and mac n cheese was ok the cornbread and potato salad was delicious.
I truly enjoyed their fried chicken. It was almost the best I have ever had. Cabbage was slightly bland but a small dab if hot sauce fixed that.

Mert's is a quality uptown soul food joint that keeps me coming back, expecting more and usually getting it. I've licked my fingers to their beef ribs, generously garnished in their house BBQ sauce. I also love their cornbread, not quite up to Mom's, but a far sight better that many one might fine in a similar restaurant, and It has always been hot when served to me, always a plus. Mert's does their wings up right, large and in charge, providing big chicken eating to a big appetite.  Always worthy of a return visit. I also love their old school atmosphere, as they keep your attention, scanning the walls for something new that you might have missed on a previous visit. I have found the staff friendly and most attentive to your wants, especially when the hot sauce runs out...

This place is so satisfying! If you haven't already heard, but their cornbread is seriously the best I've ever had! It's so moist and light and the honey butter that comes with it... Oh my goodness. My mouth waters every time I think about their famous cornbread! Their salmon cakes is so yummy too, I always start with them as an appetizer when I come in! Service is great and helpful, very friendly. Refills are a must for me, and they always keep my drinks full! Can't wait to come back to Mert's soon!

I had the beef ribs and fried chicken combo/ mac n cheese &greens side My wife had fried catfish and fried chicken combo/ potato salad $ fries side my daughter had the kid chicken tenders/mac n cheese & fries side. Were from south Jersey and have eaten at a lot of restaurants of all kinds. Hands down this is the best tasting soul food restaurant we've eaten at yet. We will be back for seconds and thirds. Excellent taste and portions absolutely nothing to complain about even the price was reasonable. You've gotta try this place if you can.
As always, Merts serves up a great atmosphere and fantastic food! The BBQ was tender and flavorful. Steamed cabbage is highly recommended.  Gonna take home a slice a coconut cake and savor it.

Went to Mertz to have dinner because of the high yelp ratings. We wanted to dine in but the  service was so slow (10 minutes and we were still in the front waiting to be seated) that we just ordered for take out. We ended up ordering the blackened pork chops and chicken soup. The soup was too salty and had to much bay leaf. The blackened pork chops were too dry. The Mac and cheese were ok and the yams were good.
We go here for brunch almost weekly for the best made-from-scratch biscuits. Both service and atmosphere reflect true southern style. A hidden gem in the uptown area.

I want to give this place no stars but it's not an option.  I heard this was "THE" soul food restaurant to eat at.  First,  the staff was not friendly and we were ignored for 10mins. I ordered the omlette and home fries, they both were awful. I then ordered the fried chicken,  collard greens and mac & cheese.  The chicken was not seasoned,  the greens were tough, and the mac & cheese was flavorless. Then to top it off the cornbread was dry and burnt. As if that wasn't enough we have felt sick since we ate there.

Ordered the Catfish Dinner plate. My collard greens weren't good at all, the Catfish was very soggy...in fact it felt as though I was eating mush!!!! He Cornbread was the best thing and Mac was okay. I wouldn't recommend his dish but maybe others are okay.

Mert's is very good soul food. Came here with a friend last week. It took a minute for the cornbread to come out because it was hot and fresh out the kitchen. I'm not a big cornbread fan, but slap some butter on this stuff and it's quite amazing.  Our server recommended the ribs, and so I ordered them with the yardbird, mac and cheese and greens. All around great. The ribs were falling off the bone, the yardbird and very good. The mac and cheese was stellar and the greens were some of the best I've tasted in North Carolina.  I finished my meal with the peach cobbler, which was fine, but not great. I kinda wished they had more chocolate options here. I would most certainly come here again.

Oh Mert's what a great place for me to checkout on my trip to Charlotte. I wanted some hardcore authentic bbq and Mert's was my destination of choice.  I ordered their legendary ribs, a side of pulled pork, collared greens and a slice of cornbread.  The ribs were great, hearty, fresh and tasty all around cooked to perfection. I was also a big fan of the collared greens, they were the best I have ever tasted.  Mert's is an awesome spot located right in downtown Charlotte. You really can't go wrong with choosing Mert's, everything on their menu was great.  Had a fun time in Charlotte and an awesome meal at Mert's!

There's not much to be said about this place that's not written already. Walked in to this place in a seemingly nicer part of the neighborhood. The inside was dark and had an old feeling to it. Typical t shirt and jeans kinda place. Ladies, do not get dolled up to come here. You will not be noticed. Not only will the darkness overshadow you, your partners will also be distracted by the amazing food to even care about your existence at that moment.   Fried chicken: outside was crispy and perfect. Just enough grease on it to leave a shimmer on your fingers. Cooked perfectly. A little tug to it. The only way this could have been better was to add some lawry's to it before coating it.   Collard greens: idc what race or ethnicity u are, you will love it. Not too wet. Just enough taste of ham hocks in there. Yea. Good.   Okra tomato think: looked diarrhea in the bowl. Tasted like heaven. I wasn't expecting that flavor to come out of this, but it hits u like heroine.  U keep wanting more.   Mac and cheese: fuck yea. 2nd best I've ever had in my life. (Smoque in Chicago has it barely beat)  The cornbread: THE BEST CORNBREAD I'VE EVER HAD!!!!!!! I won't even tell u why. Go figure it out yourself.    Bottom line: you want good southern soul food that I would stereotypically assume what soul food is, go here. It's that damn good.

Best soul food I've experienced in a long time. Mac cheese, green beans and the salmon cakes OMG!!!! GREAT TASTE, reasonable price, very casual and perfect location in Uptown to walk around after you're full!!!

Best cake I've had since my grandmother was alive.   This place is AMAZING. Seriously. I just left and I'm dying at how good everything was. Between our orders we had salmon cakes, blackened pork chops, yams, mac and cheese, and collards. Oh, and sweet potato cake and peach cobbler. All fire.   Take me back please.
Fried Chicken is the pick here.  Either the big breast or the individual wings...either is spot on.  Grilled Pork Chops is good. All the sides are good as well as the Corn Bread.

Not the best soul good I've ever eaten. My collard greens mixed with mustards? Were tough. The fried chicken was standard not anything to rave about. Salmon cakes were good. Mac n cheese can pass for soul food. Yams were great! Corn bread mediocre, overall it was okay. Don't believe the hype, especially if you were brought up on Mamas soul food cooking.

Small but Very nice atmosphere. However, I have several concerns/ suggestions. First if they're over crowded you can't wait in side even if it's rain, sleet or snow. Secondly, they should take your number and text when you're table is ready. The menu is short limited southern options. Ok now the food it took a while to get a food by the way. The Mac n cheese was lacking seasoning along with the greens, and the CHICKEN . It needs a little bit more work to be called southern food. It's not your grandmas or your aunts cooking. The corn bread sets the bar very high because it's so good but everything else failed short. The cat fish is a no go and bad presentation. Even though the food wasn't so great The service is so nice and I would come back an support black owned business anytime.

Omg so good! Healthy (ok. Kinda') soul food. Great service, very fair prices, and tasty food. What else could you want in Charlotte?? They make it good!! Very close to the venue we were attending and quick service allows for no stress about getting to the plane on time. Loved it!!

My girlfriend and I went to Mert's Heart & Soul while in Charlotte, NC looking to try some soul food that was well known in the city.  When we arrived we could see the place was crowded but were seated within a few minutes.  We ordered the Fried Green Tomato since we never had it before and it was very good.  We also tried the Soul Rolls which were also good.  For my daily fixins I ordered the Fried Cat Fish while my girlfriend had Mert's Famous Salmon Cakes.  We were happy with our food including the sides of macaroni & cheese, okra, mashed potatoes, and collard greens.  We also tried a slice of coconut cake.  The only thing we didn't like was that the restaurant seemed a bit dirty.  Overall, we really liked the food here and would recommend it to anyone looking for quality soul food.

Great southern comfort food! Felt like I was back home in my grandma's kitchen. Delicious food! Cornbread is to die for. Grilled pork chops, steamed cabbage and black eye peas were amazing. The atmosphere is simple, quaint and even quiet and the food was fulfilling and flavorful. Not overly salty eitherThe service was top notch. Extremely friendly and full of smiles. I will be back.

Here for my annual trip to Charlotte and this time I knew where to go for a good Gullah meal. I went with my teammates for a celebration meal and was introduced to Okra & Tomatoes. If you haven't tried it it's a must.  Service comes with delicious corn bread and butter or you can choose from the menu. The decor is made up of colorful walls adorned with pictures of family and friends. It can see dark in certain seating areas so have your flashlight ready. The volume is moderate so you can enjoy a conversation with your dining mates. I didn't try any of their tempting desserts.  Call ahead to find out what desserts are being served that day.

Visited for the first, but definitely not the last time.  I enjoyed salmon cakes with mac and cheese and yams and best cornbread I've had in a long time. Wonderful service and pleasant server.  Love the oldies music too. One recommendation, move the garbage can - it's right at the door; shouldn't be a focal point to your guests.  Love it and we'll be back.

The food was good. My friend said it was the best greens she has ever had!! I got the veggie platter and was satisfied. The price was reasonable, the food delish, and the bread warm! I will say that I went for Sunday brunch, and they really don't have a "brunch" menu. More like breakfast OR lunch. I was going to get breakfast items, but they are known for their soul food- so I ordered the SOUL FOOD! The service was good.

Merts fed my soul! The fried green tomatoes were delicious. Loved the black eyed peas and the okra and tomatoes was just like my family always made. I didn't care for the cabbage because I like mine seasoned with some kind of pork. The cornbread was good but I do not care for sweet cornbread. But this food will leave a great memory of my time in Charlotte, NC

Sooo initially I was told it'd be 15 minutes for my to go order over the phone....try 45 minutes with no apologies! I visited 7 years ago and had great food and service. So disappointed to experience all this and on a Sunday. There was no street parking so I was forced to tip the valet at holiday for the pickup... best thing there is cornbread which reheats quite nice

Great southern food spot .Ordered the jumbo chicken wings, mash potatoes, and macaroni. Food was bomb although I asked for the wings to be extra crispy , they came out and one the ends where crispy , the rest looked like baked chicken . Food came out super fast ! Food is very affordable for large portion sizes . Will be returning

So we came into to this place to give it a try, wanted some soul food. Walked in and the hostess was talking to someone she knew. She greeted us and continue to talk to her friend, the other host staff acted as if we weren't standing there. She finally finishes her conversation and seats us. We wait at the table about 5 to 7 minutes before the server comes to the table. He acknowledge that  we have waited a long time and that we should probably give him our order along with our drink order. So we make our decisions. We get the drinks and never see him again. We waited 40 minutes for our food!!!! The woman who sat us, delivered our food, and she said it was hot, well I touched it and it was burnt and room temperature as well as my husband did not get his complete order. We were furious! Another woman brought syrup to the table and I asked for the manager and she just happen to be the manager. We voiced our complaints and she validated them because she said she saw us waiting and that no one had been to our table. She took the food back to the kitchen to show them and said we didn't have to pay for anything. She apologized and gave us a gift card and asked us to come back, the other lyrics reason I gave one star. We do not desire to return.
In town for one night and had a taste for soul food. Our Uber driver recommended Mert's. Yessss!!! Super cool atmosphere--folksy and unpretentious, delicious and entirely affordable. Go, go, go!

I'm not usually a fish for breakfast kind of girl, but I didn't feel right about ordering a normal omelette at a place like this. Wow! I am so glad I ordered the catfish egg combo. This was definitely the best catfish I have ever had. The fish completely melted in your mouth and the seaoning & breading was delicious. Service was super friendly and quick. I don't have a single complaint! I will definitely stop back in on my next trip to Charlotte.

When my friend and I walked in, we were immediately greeted by several people. Everyone was smiling and nice, and we were given a table outside. The waitress said she could tell our chairs were uncomfortable, so she switched them for better seats. I had the beef ribs and chicken breast quarter, with yams and macaroni and cheese. The ribs were different than I typically like (vinegary maybe) and the chicken was a little dry, but I loved how it wasn't overly salty like southern food sometimes is. The cornbread was good, but not as sweet as I like. The peach cobbler was different, but good. I got it to go and forgot it in my car so I didn't eat much. It was a good lunch with beautiful weather, so I'd go back.

YUMM CORNBREAD. This place probably has the best cornbread I've ever had in my life. Period.  I was in town for a day, and wanted to pick up somethingfor the road. My colleagues recommended Mert's, and I'm glad I went. I ordered a catfish, collard greens, and acorn squash for me, and a beef tips, mac n' cheese, and collard greens for the special guy picking me up from the airport. I gobbled down the cornbread right away, it was so delicious. Now I know nothing tastes as good as when it's first made, but for surviving a 10-hour trip, these meals were pretty darn good.  Highly recommend!

After eating a disappointing, overpriced dinner the night before, my group was thrilled to find this sweet spot in downtown Charlotte! We loved the quirky decor and immediately felt the warm fuzzies for our energetic waitress. We were there for breakfast, but I personally was excited to hear that there were meat and veggies choices available too. Good flavored coffee was a welcome beginning , as was the yummy cornbread and crunchy biscuits. 5 stars would have been given , but some in our party said their omelette choices were just ok. My non traditional meal of salmon patties, collard greens and home fries was yummy!  Everything was seasoned and cooked perfectly. I look forward to a return to this place.  Egg rolls filled with collards and black eyed peas and roasted veggies are on my list of things to try next time.  Gourmet soul food at its best!

The way to go at Mert's  is.. To go and never come back. I went to Mert's after trying their featured food at the taste of charlotte 2017, and being delighted with what they presented. The food they served at the food festival and what they truly serve at the restaurant is completely different. It was misleading and money was wasted. I've never regretted eating at a restaurant to this extent. Their macaroni and cheese tasted like powder. Their mashed potatoes were wack. Everything was wack. the water was even wack.  This restaurant is like going to your moms friends house that doesn't cook well.

Finally made it out to Mert's over the weekend and wasn't disappointed. I got the salmon cakes which had solid flavor and came with a remoulade sauce that kicked them up a bit without being overwhelmingly spicy.  The cornbread was big, flaky and delicious.  Mac and cheese had more of a creamy consistency to it, with good flavor.  Green beans were also fantastic.  Huge portions - I had my leftovers for dinner. Service was a bit slow, but they were busy, so all is forgiven. Our waitress was very attentive and offered to replace a salmon cake that was a bit burned without us asking.

Everyone raves about the cornbread and they are right! The cornbread is very unique to Mert's. I love the fish on the menu. Also, this is a great place for breakfast. Make sure you grab a slice of cake. You won't be disappointed,
I had the salmon patties, collar greens and blackeyed peas. It was absolutely delicious.  I am in town for two nights. I plan to go back for supper tomorrow.

Horrible service!!! Server forgot to put our order in. Came back 30 minutes later with lame lie. Another 20 minutes later still no food, not even apps. Hostess also provided 2 new lame lies. We left and will never go back. Dishonest staff ruined it for me. Honesty would  have gone over better. Went to Tupelo Honey Cafe instead. Awesome service and FOOD!!

CORN BREAD!!  CAKE BAR!!  LEMON CAKE!!  Now that I've gotten that out of my system......  I love soul food!  I don't eat it often, but when I do I want it to feel like Sunday dinner.  Mert's did that for me.  I ordered the beef ribs and was a little disappointed, but that's what happens when you live in the BBQ capital of the world for about 8 years (TX).  Aside from that, the sides were just as good as it gets.  I love that they cook their greens with vinegar which is such a southern thing.  I threw a couple of drops of Texas Pete on there and my taste buds were in heaven.  Their famous salmon cakes were a bit dry for my taste.  Maybe I caught a bad batch, but I'd like to believe that they can be waaay more tender and moist.  The wait staff were so funny and friendly.  I felt completely at home.  I'm hoping they expand soon because seating does get tight!  We were seated by the exit door and on a 30 something degree night it literally takes the warmth away from the atmosphere and my food, lol!  I don't care what any of the nay-sayers say, Merts is good stuff!  If you want to see things get better for next time, just say so.  Yelp is powerful and most businesses take what we say to heart as long as it's constructive and comes from a place of caring and not cynicism.

Cornbread should be cake it so sweet Collard greens had to be the worst I have ever had. No flavor come straight out of a bag and ever little cooking to them and no seasoning Beef ribs touch cold and the worst bbq I have ever tasted My salad was serviced in a tea cup plate. It was a joke The food came cold and tasteless This place is not worth what the price for the bad food you get  My first........and my LAST PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY  16.00 LATER AND NOW I HAVE TO GO GET SOMETHING I CAN EAT!!!!!!!!!

Had a pretty good Groupon for this place- wife enjoyed the collards, fried chicken was finger licking good. Avoid the soup which was reaally a cup of broth. And steer clear of the Carolina Blond beer yuck. Loved our sassy southern waitress & the corn bread she brought us. We will be back.

I really, really wanted to like this place.  But unfortunately, when I was served chicken that was not fully cooked inside, that really just nose-dived this place to 2 stars.  We were recommended this place by a local coworker of mine since I was in Charlotte on business.  Apparently this is the place to go for some good ole greasy soul food.  BF and I started off with the salmon cakes appetizer ($7.60) which were delicious!  The "remoulade" sauce that it comes with is perfect with the salmon.  I ordered the southern fried chicken leg with collard green and mac n cheese ($8.79).  BF ordered the fried catfish with collard greens and mac n cheese($15).  And all meals come with a piece of their infamous corn bread -- which was easily the best cornbread that I'd ever had.  Everything was great until I got into the center of my chicken, where it was uncooked at the bone.  Our waitress came to check on us and saw my chicken and started to apologize profusely.  She took my entire plate and said she would get me a new chicken leg.  On the way to the kitchen, she showed another waitress the leg and they both started shaking their heads.  She eventually came back with a fully cooked chicken leg at no extra charge which was cool, but I was almost full since I had eaten almost half of my previous chicken before I got to the raw part.  The rest of the food was great and the prices were definitely favorable, but it was unfortunate that I ended up with the uncooked chicken.  Not sure if I'd come back next time I am in Charlotte on business.

Sunday morning the cornbread hits the spot.  The rest of the meal, food and service, was mediocre at best. To tell the truth, the service ran along the lines of pretty poor. We sat outside and the tables around us were annoyed with the bad service too. Actually the woman at the table of three directly across from us kept telling customers to "go away" when they came dine. She also was served the wrong meal but no one ever came back to check on her.  We started the meal with the fried green tomatoes - Fresh green tomatoes battered in a herb and flour blend, lightly fried to perfection and served with our own remoulade sauce - it was served with our cornbread and the server said she would return with side plates but never did. She never refilled our drinks either. The fried green tomatoes had a very heavy batter on them. It was hard to find "tomatoes" in the dish. I would resist trying this appetizer.  We waited a long time for our main course which is why it was probably cold when it arrived at our table. Scott had the special beef tip omelet with potatoes. He had asked for wheat toast but we were told they had none and they would bring white. They never bought the toast or asked if his meal was good. I tried the Mert's famous salmon cakes. These were dry and cold and my sides the macaroni & cheese - tasty - and okra & tomatoes - greasy? - were also suffering from being left sitting waiting for someone to bring them to our table.   After finally chasing someone down inside we got our check. With all the options in the neighborhood to try we probably won't add this to our list of great places to dine.

If you're new to Charlotte and still adjusting to living in the New South, go to Mert's Heart & Soul in uptown. I can pretty much guarantee that the macaroni and cheese, sweet tea, biscuits, meatloaf and all the other soul food will remind you why Charlotte is a good place to live.   You can order food from Mert's online, which is a convenient perk. I've been to a couple events catered by Mert's. Mm mm.
You can't help but love this joint and the food that they serve. Best. Biscuits. Ever!

The service never goes wrong in North Carolina.  Everyone is always so damn nice!  I was looking for decent Southern food  in the downtown area..and this place has got it all!  I got an order of fried chicken (leg/dark meat) with grits and collard greens as sides.  The chicken was not deeeep fried.  Baked and juicy with crispy skin.  Sides were standard for NC quality (This is a compliment.  I will not be able to find this in the Northeast!).  On top of it all, they give you hot, soft, delicious complimentary cornbread.

i was actually disappointed. my friends had raved about merts... and i like my mom's ribs better. i had a 2 meat combo, and they were just dry. the mac and cheese was disappointing. the food was too rich (i can't believe that I would say anything like that) and greasy... the cake was WAAAAAY too sweet.... i dunno.   the service was fantastic, and the location was super convenient, especially if you are staying at the holiday inn. but overall... this isn't a place i was recommending.

My how they've changed. More than disappointed.  I didn't write a review the last time because I was hoping it was a fluke. However, it's not. The service is always great. But the food is just not the same. I had the fried chicken meal and both my chicken and side items seemed tasteless. The lemonade was fresh but lacked sugar. Not sure what happened but my family was disappointed overall with their meals. Ok but not good.

Wow is this place amazing!! Some of the best derive in the city!! Everyone was very kinda and friendly. The corn bread was drop dead amazing, chicken tenders and potato salad all felt someone's grandma was cookin it up in the back!! Rhasaan waited on up and helped up pick out all the best things on the menu and we left with sweet potato cake!!

We came to eat dinner here because we love BBQ restaurants. It was wonderful! My husband had bbq pork and I had salmon cakes. So good! The sides were all good. I wish I had room for cake but I was too full. The staff was great. They really hustle to get people seated and served. I'd definitely go again.

My husband and I went here for the first time yesterday, & liked it! Their menu has all of the traditional soul foods one would expect, the servers were nice, the food was very tasty, the portion sizes are BIG, & the prices are economical. We'd definitely go back & recommend it to others.

The anticipation for this visit was high. I had heard nothing but great things about Mert's. I must say the Food was fantastic. The cornbread was like something your grandmother made and a very large portion with a side of sweet butter. I got the fried chicken with greens and beans. The chicken was crispy and to die for. The greens were just succulent. Now, the food was great but the dining experience was ruined due to terrible service. The minute we walked in and were greeted by a server with an attitude I knew this might be dreadful. Our drink orders were about 10 minutes getting to the table and we were never offered a refill. Our server just stood at the end of the table waiting to take out order but didn't speak. After we gave her our order she couldn't remember it and Asked for it again. She never made eye contact with us and was rushed even though they were not busy.   The customer service can make or break a dining experience and I can tell you we would have just left it the food wasn't so great. However, we will not be back. I hope you are able to recognize the need for a attitude change for your servers.

THANK YOU, Yelpers!! Maybe the best home cookin' I've eaten, and that covers a lot!  Beef spare ribs, fried chicken, shrimp & grits, salmon, collards, black eyed peas, Mac n cheese, slaw, and oh the cornbread that was served first!!  Seriously wanted a slice of one of the half doz cakes but, alas, no room. Guess we'll just have to come back.... And we sat next to a friendly lady sipping a beer in a Pilsner glass thru a straw; that's a first. Wish we could clone this place!

As much of a fan as I am of "soul food," I just can't seem to find the right thing at Mert's. I have tried this restaurant twice and I have been underwhelmed both times. The prices seem to be a bit high given the quality and portions of the food. This most recent visit was my return visit to use my unused Groupon of which I had purchased two a year ago. I went with the lamb at the suggestion of the server and the parts of it that were not burnt to a crisp were truly delicious. The potato salad was really good, as was the mac and cheese. The yams weren't even close to those that my Mom makes, but hey..maybe I'm biased. Part of the downfall of Mert's for me is due to the fact that I have had Lawan's and they are on a completely different level. Mert's seems almost a bit commercial to me and it seems that maybe the food isn't prepared fresh (although I did have to wait a long time).   I'm willing to give them another try, but I don't really want to pay for it so it's likely not going to happen. I love soul food and the people there were super friendly so I wish them continued success, however I'll be heading to Lawan's for my soul food fixes for now.

My parents came from out of town so I took them Merts for dinner. Now the hubby and I have been to Merts for lunch and dinner but this Friday was terrible! The macaroni and cheese was watered down looking like velvetta cheese, collard greens were bland, sweet tea wasn't sweet, fried chicken was soggy. Mom was hungry so she peeled the skin off and ate the meat. She also had to pick through a ton of stalks in the collard greens. I asked them if they had a new chef they said no but new prep people I'm like well y'all need to teach them something cause today's dinner was horrible. So it seems Merts is either hit or miss depending on who's cooking or not!

Looking for a brunch spot before heading to the airport in Charlotte, my husband and I chose Mert's because of the reviews we read.  And it was a great find!    This place has character, from the portraits and decor, to the bathrooms to the staff.  Tthe service was great - we were visisted by at least 4 different staff members, but it was seamless.  The food also had character - I had the red beans and rice with smoked turkey.  It was just alright.  But if that was the low point of the meal, I will take it!  After reading the reviews, we had to try the sweetpotato pancakes.  WOW - they were definitely worthy of the praise!  The homefriends were also delish.  My husband had the biscuits and gravy and was fat and happy with his choice.   I am not sure that this restaurant is worth a trip back to Charlotte on its own, but we will definitely be back if we are in the area!  There are so many more things on the menu to try!!

Oh yes, that cornbread with butter was SO GOOD!!  YUMMMMM!  Other than that, my friend and I both got the fried chicken with two sides.  The fried chicken was pretty solid, as was the potato salad!  The mac 'n cheese was alright-I feel like I always get excited to have mac 'n cheese as a side dish wherever I go, but it's hardly ever amazing (when will I learn to give that up??).  Anyways, the service was quick and friendly.  It was pretty packed here, but there was luckily no wait on a Saturday night.

I had the beef short ribs, collards and Opera n tomatoes.  Collards are the best. Never had em with chopped onion and chopped maters b4 but that's fixin to b standard at our house. Just a hint of vinegar and spice. Really good.  Okra n maters were great too. Cooked tender - crisp. Not mushy or slimy.  Beef short ribs were well done and seasoned moderately.  You can always put hot sauce on if you want more heat. Texas Pete, Cholula n an oriental offering were on the table.  The wife had fried chicken breast quarter, collards n black eyes.  The chicken was OK but not great. It was a bit over done and had a bit of an old oil taste.  The peas had a peculiar herb flavor that neither of us has tasted b4. That didn't work for us. She loved the collards.  The cornbread n butter were great.  I tried a Carolina Blonde ale that the waitress described as a cream ale.  It was more like an India pale ale. It was good.  The service was prompt, pleasant and timely. Food was served quickly.  Prices were very reasonable. Unusual for a downtown restaurant, especially in the tony hotel neighborhood.  Overall, a pleasant early dinner.
The worst restaurant ever! It doesn't matter if the food tastes good or not.. The service is the worst! Lazy and slow as ever!
Excellent food and good service. I highly recommend if you are seeking good southern cooking.

This was our second visit and we weren't disappointed.  Had the fried whiting, mac and cheese, and yams. Those soul rolls (OMG), could have had a full meal of them. DELICIOUS.  Mozelle was the best. Beautiful and friendly. Will definitely be back next trip to Charlotte.

I liked the laid back homey feel of this place and their cornbread and BBQ sauce was really tasty.  However we never got our drinks, and when we did finally they were extremely warm glasses of wine and beer, none of us actually even finished them. Our server was not friendly and the food didn't wow us. Our table of 5 shared several sides, best were the mac and cheese and potato salad, their Cole slaw and black eyed peas we didn't get second helpings of. Reasonably priced and large portions so bang for your buck, but as an out-of-towner, if I came back would try somewhere else.

I was only in Charlotte for 3 days and I managed to eat here all 3 days. The best thing about this place is the sides. Collard greens, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes.. I could eat them forever. I still think about those collard greens...  The ribs and salmon cakes were alright, nothing to drool over.  Coconut cake-- super sweet and moist, really good but will probably induce diabetes

Terrible service.....horrible service.  I ordered chicken and waffle.  I got a hot glass of wine, and my initial order was a 3/4 hard waffle then they brought me out a cold full waffle, the butter would not melt.  I wanted to like this place but I cant get past the HORRIBLE customer service.

O man, this place is amazing!  Ok ok, I'm not an expert in soul food or southern food, but if this is even close to what it is...uhhhh I AM A FANATIC.   Gotta try the beef ribs and fried catfish combo. The collard greens, okra, rice sides are not to be missed. Fried chicken was great! Cornbread that comes with the meals are not sweet but very very very buttery.   Only thing I would say was ehh was the salmon cake, that was a bit dry.

I finally got myself to Mert's for dinner the other night after reading all the great reviews. Unfortunately, I left unfulfilled.   The staff is nice, when you can actually get a hold of them. Be prepared to wait for everything. 10 minutes for someone to acknowledge us as we first walked in. Another 10 minutes for our server to greet us. Another 15 minutes for our food to show. Then another 10 minutes to get our check. This is just too slow for me.  The food was good. The cornbread held up to my high expectations; buttery with perfect texture. The BBQ pulled pork had a unique flavor. It is an intense, delicious flavor; but after the first few bites the intensity and vinegar becomes a bit overwhelming. My wife's fried chicken was also good.   Mert's would be a solid 4 star if the service was more attentive. It deserves another visit.

THE BEST soul food I've had in a long time. Being from Georgia i thought we had the best soul food and BOY was i wrong. I look forward to my next visit here. EVERYTHING was delicious and the customer service was excellent.

We LOVE Merts! What a great place to dine regularly & bring out of town guests. We've lived in Charlotte almost a year. Merts was the first place we dined in Charlotte & we continue to go back often & have taken almost all of our out of town guests. We just took my parents (from the Midwest) & they loved it, too. Great soul food and good service. Merts is always busy, but the food comes out quickly & is always tasty. The veg plates offer vegetarians or folks who just want to try a lot of sides a great dining option. Our guests have enjoyed the catfish, shrimp, ribs, fried chicken, & BBQ. And, the cornbread is to die for. Best cornbread I've ever had. We like that it always comes out hot & fresh & that you get real butter (instead of the packets most places serve today) to lather on your individual loaf. I can't say enough great things about Merts. Great place!

Yum!! I was in town for a conference. A larger group of us went but my car load had gotten message late so we were arrived a good 20 min after our crew. They actually accommodated us as well as was possible, sitting us quickly and close to the other group. One of my colleagues was a little nervous about the authenticity of a soul food restaurant in the heart of downtown. Man. Oh. Man. Do not let the location fool you. Inside it is as down home as it gets.   The food was great. I had the catfish, yams and green beans. It was a bit salty for my taste but otherwise great! The loaf of cornbread came out first and I had to stop myself from eating it like it was the meal. It was perfect. Not too sweet and not too dry. My table mates had red beans and rice and some sides and the other one had a salad and some sides. I have no idea why he had a salad at a soul food place but he was the happiest of us all about the restaurant. Crazy! Ha. We compared Mert's to other soul food places and laughed at how people are so hard on soul food places.   The place was packed and the cool thing was the crowd was pretty diverse. I think you can tell a lot about a place by the crowd that eats there. This one seemed to appeal to everyone. So I would definitely go back. The service was kind of sketchy. She was fast and it was accurate we just had to ask for things that seemed standard - like refills & to go boxes. It was super busy though. All and all It's in the top 5 of soul food places I've been to across the country. The atmosphere and the music were also pretty fun. My only regret is that I didn't try the cobbler. Oh and if you're like me you will get enough food for 2 meals. Be prepared!

First, let me start by saying I grew up on soul food, so my expectations for a soul food restaurant are high.  Unfortunately, Mert's is a failure to the soul food world.   They are located/attached to the Holiday Inn City Center, so I automatically assumed that the food and service would match the location, wrong! The service wasn't horrible, it was just slow.   The food on the other hand was horrible; the best thing I ate was the cornbread. The collard greens tasted like a mixture of vinegar, salt and lemon juice had been poured in the pot; I took one bite and realized that I was done with that portion of my meal. The cabbage was decent, but my cabbage looked moldy, yikes! The okra and tomatoes dish was meh; the okra was there, but the tomatoes were missing in action. The macaroni and cheese was old and dry. I am completely disappointed.  Will not return and I don't recommend you waste your money here. This place has an overall 3 star review for a reason.

I'm appalled that mert's has a 3.5 star rating on here. If you are looking for food-coma inducing, delicious soul food, this is your place. I usually go for the salmon cake meal with Mac and cheese and collards and I drool over the delicious cornbread they bring as an appetizer. Everything here is melt in your mouth indulgent and the atmosphere is so fun. Go for the strawberry cake if you manage to save room. You will not regret it. As a side note this place also has a pretty decent brunch.

First time i ate here. My wife and I sat outside on the terrace. The food was good. The 3 stars are for the following reasons: 1) as soon as our food was served, the waiter gave us the bill. He said he wasnt rushing us but who gives you the bill before even have taken 1 bite of your food. 2) when the waiter came to check up on us he saw i was paused eating my food. In other words i was taking my time. I even told him. He immediately insisted in bringing a box. Didnt even ask us if we wanted dessert. The cakes looked bomb but we didnt even get a chance to order it. 3) overall we felt very rushed. Our waiter was a cool guy but he really made us feel like we needed to eat quick and get the f out.   The whole giving us the bill right before even eating our food was weird. He did it to no one else who was sitting around us.   Anyways good food. Nice staff. But our waiter killed it by rushing us out of there.
Ooooh I'll tell ya! Southern done right! Had me some ribs and fried chicken with some Texas Peete hot sauce!! Oooooh weeee! Soul rolls are for real. Guy fieri ain't no liar. No he ain't.

Been a couple of times, salmon cakes and cornbread are my fav, they offer great veggie options.... but please please please put customer service ready cashiers on the phone to take peoples orders. I placed a lunch order and the woman I spoke to was very blunt and acted as if I was bothering her. I asked how long will my food take she said it would "be ready when I arrived" usually I get an estimate so it pretty much seemed as though she wanted to keep her answers short and abrupt. She also tried to over talk me when I asked the question and answer by interrupting me. It seems as though she did not want my business and I gave her what she wanted. I certainly did place an order at another restaurant. Please do better.

Food was on point and very delicious,  however our waitress was NOT the deal. He wasn't very friendly and added extra food to the order, repetitive of things that I did order causing me to have lots of the same things.  He didn't explain how orders came and often heard us call him only to pause and glance in our direction. We were NOT rude or anything of that nature. Greens could have been a lil better instead of like leaves but other than that,  I loved it. I won't let that one black monkey stop my show! !! I will be back!!!!

Go for the cornbread, stay for the mac and cheese and bbq pork.  The salmon cake has an interesting flavor, but the texture reminded me of crab cakes. I will stick with crab cakes in the future, but glad I tried something new.   If I ever make it back to Charlotte, I'd swing by again for the cornbread.

Eight of us went to Mert's today for lunch.  We started out our meal with fried green tomatoes and soul rolls.  The soul rolls were delicious.  I had the beef ribs with Mac and cheese and okra and tomatoes.  The ribs were good, but the sauce was sweeter than preferred.  The Mac and cheese was excellent and the okra was good.  Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals.  Service was excellent.

Our table agreed that the best part of this meal was the corn bread. Every order was lacking just that little something that would make a meal enjoyable. One person in our party of seven has said that he will return to give them another try.  The rest of us will not be back
Bought a fried turkey for thanksgiving - thank goodness I had a back up!  Turkey was not cooked (raw inside). The gravy was really good though. What a waste!

Let me preface this by saying, I cook and cook well.  My family is from down south originally, and the family side from the midwest can cook.  So I'm biased when it comes to 'soul food' or 'southern food.'  Being in Charlotte from LA, my expectations aren't super high for soul food, seeing as though all we have is Roscoe's out there, which is average, but still the only 'go to' spot when you want soul food that you didn't prepare.   The girl at the register, was SUPER nice.  She answered my questions, and had some spunk and personality to her.  Call me weird, but bad attitudes and customer service don't go together.  So she was a pleasant surprise, especially considering 2 other ladies seemed to throw a couple dirty looks my way versus asking me if I had been helped.    Ended up ordering take out:  Got the fried chicken wings with 2 sides. Mac & cheese and collard greens.  Also ordered the salmon cakes appetizer (b/c of the raving yelp reviews) And the banana pudding.   Wings were just ok.  I'd give them 2.5 stars.  Not much flavor.  But if you don't know much about frying chicken, I could see how this place would be great for you to get your fix.   Salmon cakes: TERRIBLE.  The sauce that comes on the side was good, but they just didn't do it for me.  I took 3 bites and tossed them. 1 star.  Mac & Cheese: GREAT! 5 stars.  Should have just ordered a tub of that lol.   Greens: blah.  Too vinegary and bland.  I'm a greens snob.  So these were super below par for me.  1.5 stars  Banana pudding:  4 stars.  Pretty tasty.  Even though I just ate the bites where I could find some vanilla cookie and then once that was gone, tossed the rest.    Overall it was ok.  I'm going to try the other place later next week, called 'king's kitchen?' and see if they are any better.
Cheap, tasty, in the heart of Town.  A must try!  Bottomless mimosas on weekends are key to curing a long night!

We went to Mert's based on the reviews on yelp and that it was one of the fav's listed in our travel guide.  And boy, I am so glad we did!    I'm not normally a fan of southern cooking, but the food is tasty but not cloyingly rich which I really appreciate.  The service is fast and friendly.  We wanted to try the cobbler based on the reviews and I wanted apple or blueberry but turns out they only have peach which was fine, it's a cornbread cobbler so the taste is a little salty, but really yummy.    Great find!  Thanks yelpers!
We loved the ribs and fried chicken! The Mac n cheese and mashed potatoes were awesome. Husband loved the green beans. Good service too!
Great food great staff never again kings kithen! Jim nobles close shop! Thank you guys a great place great food!

I couldn't even eat what I wanted on the menu because their sanitation grade is low..... this 90 includes the 2 bonus points they received for attending the ServSafe class.. the staff was friendly but the workers continued to chat with each other when they could have been working.

Came here with a friend for a meal recently, and by god...it was delicious! Everything about it - from the cornbread to the bbq ribs, everything was decadent but not extremely heavy. We ordered their famous salmon cakes, their ribs platter, with mac and cheese sides, homefries, collard greens, and their okra and tomato stew.  The mac and cheese and collard greens were average (at least in my opinion since I didn't grow up eating soul food I probably can't say too much about the taste of these two items), but the stars of the meal were the cornbread (this was by far the best cornbread I have ever tasted in my life....getting sweeter with every bite), the ribs (in this tangy sweet bbq sauce that you just want to dip everything into it), and the salmon cakes (these tasted confusing at first but gradually the unmistakable salmon flavor seeps through - truly umami in your mouth).  The salmon cakes really surprised me. I expected fried fish patties, at the very least dripping with oil or grease, but instead got these lovely, grilled tasty salmon cakes that were absolutely amazing but weren't heavy at all (the fattening feeling you get after eating fried foods).   Bottom line, go for anything with sides and cornbread to try as much of their menu as possible. And believe this place is the real thing (big quantities and good quality...and affordable!)- the inside makes you feel like you're in the old South and they've got dim lighting that makes this place glow warmly from the inside. Also, it helps that Hillary Clinton chose to eat at this place for lunch two days ago on her visit to Charlotte. There ya go.

Here visiting for Father's Day and wow!   Good low country soul food.   Enough to make this Texas not very happy.   Seated promptly and ordered the salmon cakes.   Homemade corn bread to start doesn't get any better, it is perfect.   A little sweet and taste like crazy corn bread should. You need to stop either for a meal or a little nosh when visiting Charlotte.

Always friendly, the staff here will usually go out of their way to make sure you have a great meal. Everything I've tried is great, but special note goes to the cornbread and the catfish. The collard greens are also great, slightly tangy and with a good feel, not overcooked. This is soul food without going overboard on salt and fat. Of course, they are there, just not as much as some soul food places.  I wish they had pie.
The cornbread was the best part of the meal, all the other menu items I tried was sub-par.

Soul food is tricky for me, being southern I have a steady diet of "soul food." The tricky part comes in bc the actual food doesn't deliver. I like to try foods I don't normally make myself, so I avoid the usual staples like collards, beans, and mac & cheese. I tried the beef ribs, yams, and black eyed peas. I should have ordered the staples. The yams were the best part, just sweet enough. The peas were oddly sweet also...yuck. Salty, yes. Hammy, word. Sweet, gross. The beef ribs were a joke the serving was one and a half pieces and six bones. Of course I rolled my eyes and muttered to myself but since I was with company I kept quiet. As with most soul food places,  I think this place caters to folks that don't have a momma that can throw down.

While visiting Charlotte from Birmingham, AL, we stopped by Mert's for lunch. We absolutley LOVED it. Our waitress was amazing and the food was even better. By far the best cornbread I have ever had in my life. When ever I come to Charlotte I'll always eat here. I had the Salmon cakes which are made with fresh salmon and I loved how spicy the collard greens were. Thanks for such a wonderful dining experience.
Good hearty food with fast and friendly service. I had a BBQ omelet with grits and homemade biscuits, the biscuits were so good!

Go to Mert's if you want good southern comfort food!  their cornbread is great and they always have lots of cakes and pies for dessert options.  This place is a Charlotte tradition and if you are visiting town - plan a have at least 1 meal here.

Around 2pm, I decided I needed to eat and found this place based on a nearby shopkeepers recommendation. As soon as I walked in the door I was greeted and shown a seat. The decor was fun and made it feel southern. This is the first time I have had Southern food, so I may not be as discriminating as some with more experience.   With that being said, I ordered lemonade and water to drink. My waitress brought delicious cornbread before my meal. For food I ordered the BBQ chicken, yams and collard greens. Their greens come with a tomato and onions but since I told the waitress I had never had them before she said they are good by themselves and maybe I should try them that way.  The food didn't take long to arrive and the portions were decent. Not huge, but since I'm not a big eater, it was perfect. The flavor was good for all the items.   The food was reasonably priced and food. I would recommend it and go here again.
The fried catfish was perfect.  The sides were good too.  the service was good and the people friendly.  Good place.

It's been several years since I've been to Mert's, and I have to say I was a little let down.  Now don't get me wrong the food is still good, although not consistent from dish to dish.  The cornbread is on point, buttered to die for.  The Salmon cakes were not very well seasoned, the collards on the tasteless side. The Mac and cheese was creamy and delish.    The service is still terrific, the staff friendly and very attentive. They greeted me like they just saw me yesterday, with that "come in and set a spell", Southern charm.    While my meal was not great, I would go again for the "Tiger Wood" (sweet iced tea/lemonade), and to try something different on the menu,

Always looking to try local owned and Mert's was great. We came for early lunch right when they opened on a Monday. Everyone raves about the cornbread and it was amazing but my favorite is the salmon cakes and the red beans and rice with turkey sausage. The atmosphere is casual and comfortable. If you are uptight and concerned about wanting to be catered to in a formal setting, this isn't it. However, the service is friendly and prompt. Park behind the Holiday Inn in the garage and Mert's with validate.

Second time to dine at Mert's.  It's Thursday night and the wait for takeout was just as long for a table.  The advantage of being on the road and dining for one did mean I got seated much quicker than the people on the wait list.  This time I ordered the salmon cake with yam and slaw, which Yelpers were highly recommending.  The sweet yam was like a dessert in itself - and I love candied yam so that was big tick for me.  The slaw was finely chopped and creamy, also lived up to expectation.  The Salmon cake tho - slightly under salted.  Seeing that this is poached salmon with added flavoring after, I think maybe some of the salmon flavor got lost along the way.  Overall still tasty and solid but I would say their other items such as fried chicken and ribs were more to my liking.  Service was also  little chaotic - it was packed.  The waitress brought me my food with my cutlery, and then my ice tea never came (I forgot about it too but never saw my waitress coming by and too hungry to wait).  And when I asked to get it to go, I ended up with sweetened tea instead of unsweetened.  Oh well.

Real stuff, all good, all tasty. Helpful, attentive  staff. Sixties and seventies Motown music.  Food: Good, authentic, clean, tasty.  Decor: Cool Southern folk art and celebrity photos  Service: Fun, informative, and friendly.

First...absolutely the best service I've had ever. We tipped her 50%. She was that good. The biscuits are better than Flying Biscuit's. Salmon cakes were flavorful. Veggies were perfectly flavored. Good experience all around.

If you're looking for a place that has some decent soul food with OK service at moderate prices, then Mert's is the place for you.  This place did not knock my socks off.  The food was ok.  It wasn't the most amazing seasoning, but everything was cooked correctly.  The corn muffins were huge and came out hot, but didn't have that gritty corn texture that I hate about corn muffins.  I don't know what they do to those tasty treats, but it beats bringing out a bread basked any day.  The downside was that they did not have any of the "specials" listed on the chalk board above the kitchen.  Mert's...you can't put broccoli & cheese up there and expect me to be like "oh yeah, I didn't want that anyway even though it's been staring me in the face for the last 15 minutes."  The server was really nice. I'm also not sure if the Manager was also helping out, but he was certainly on the floor taking care of business.  The decor seemed like a bit of a mish mosh.  It wasn't a dirty place, but it definitely seemed a bit outdated and pieced together.  I don't know if I'll be back, but if I have a friend in uptown looking for some comfort food, I'll send them over to Mert's.

My co worker had recommended this place to me months ago, but since I had been greatly underwhelmed by just about all of the so-called 'Soul Food' restaurants that I have visited ever since I moved down South, I quickly forgot about her recommendation. The other night, while I was watching Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, I was pleasantly surprised when they put a spotlight on Merts. I had to go give it a try. Long story short, phenomenal Soul Food that's greatest strength is how simple and yet flavorful it is! The Beef Ribs were wonderful, very meaty and moist; the Salmon Cakes were savory and delicious with or without the included remoulade; the Macaroni and Cheese is thick, rich and hearkens back to a time when people put time and care into what they did; the Seasoned Rice is perfectly cooked and very flavorful; and the Soul Rolls will leave you wishing that the portion was MUCH bigger because they're so good. Oh yeah, did I forget to mention that this food was this awesome and I ordered Take-out? All in all, as good as advertised and they greatly exceeded my expectations. I definitely WILL be back.

Omg!!!!! The best salmon patties I've ever had (sorry momma) lol....my fiancé and I had the 4 way veggie platter.... the mac and cheese..seasoned rice....yams....cornbread and potatoe salad (we both had a mixture) was great!!!! I felt like I was back at my grandmas...the service was good and the staff was very friendly....I would for sure go back!!!
Great comfort food!  Really cool find downtown near the train, museums, etc.  Love it!

Food is great. Service staff needs serious upgrading. Upselling, explanation of daily specials, and just common hospitality is lacking. Manager is young yet vibrant and willing to go the extra mile. I give this place three stars due to poor service but if that improves I would easily rate this spot 4.5
Omg best service and food ever!! We tried the beef ribs and fried chicken, most juicy food ever! Hands down the best cornbread ever :) this California boy is digging NC soul food haha

This is one of the places that you have to go to if you are in Charlotte.  It is local and very unique and you will not find anything like it anywhere else.    The food is interesting and the atmosphere is very unique.  I have been there many times and have never been disspointed.

First time in Charlotte, great food. Started with the soul rolls, then went with the red beans & rice with Turkey Sausage, side of home made corn bread & grits. Had a beer. Went with a half slice of sweet potato cake, everything was $25. Service was great also.

Being from the south all of my life, I know great food. This was just okay to me. The fried chicken disappointed me a little. It wasn't as tasteful as I expected. BUT the cornbread tastes just like my grandma's (which is heavenly) and the Mac & cheese is pretty great. My boyfriend got fried chicken tenders which were more flavorful than the fried chicken wings. The soul roll appetizers were tasty too. Although service was quick, our server was also a bit on the attitude-y side. She answered questions snarkly, talked to us while walking away, and barely responded to questions to make sure she heard me. She then made a comment about her tip which would have been more if she had not had such an unfit mood. I'd definitely go back but only in the hopes of a more pleasant server!

I heard so many beautiful things about there tasty oxtails. On a Saturday summer night, they had no more oxtails  after placing my order and I was disappointed... no business should be out of their favorite dishes by the patrons.  I hope then I go back they will have oxtails.

Mert's is a great find in downtown Charlotte.  The service is solid and the food is pretty good.  They have a beer and wine menu, but seem surprised when you order and adult beverage.  I took my servers suggestion and ordered beef ribs and fried fish.  It arrived along with sides of macaroni and cheese and black eyed peas.  The black eyes were some of the best I have ever had.  The beef ribs were really short ribs and were gristly and disappointing.  My husband opted for the special "Tia's Chicken" - chicken breaded with Parmesan and Italian seasoning topped with cream sauce.  This along with green beans and sweet potatoes made for a solid meal.  The chicken was good and a huge portion.  If back in Charlotte, we would definitely visit again.

I come from Harlem so my take on what southern/soul food should be is probably a bit skewed but one thing I can differentiate between is f'n bad food and f'n good food.  Mert's is definitely good.   The service was kind, warm and attentive even though it was a bit busy in there.  I ordered the Shrimp Creole dish and by no means was I disappointed. It was saucy plus spicy (those traits can't be wrong in women nor food), small shrimp goodness ladled on top of rice.  The cornbread comes before your meal and good thing I don't judge on the free food.  Just sayin'.  One thing to write home about is the COLLARD GREENS! I could eat a lasagna dish full of just their greens.  It's slightly bitter, balanced out with butter and a slight citrus taste and perfectly cooked.  You must try it!  My only complaint is the cleanliness, the place needs a little TLC especially in the corners that people (unlike me) don't typically look, or don't want to anyway. Give it a rub down.  All and all, 2 contently hard nipples for Mert's.

Was down in Charlotte this past weekend looking for a place to eat and we walk past this restaurant so we decide to go and grab some food. We have some soul food restaurants in Philadelphia but this is by far is the best I've ever been to. The collar greens were cook perfect and the mac & cheese was amazing. When I go back to Charlotte I'll definitely be making this a must stop.  Can you guys open a restaurant in Philadelphia please...

Portions are huge (any plate can feed two and I am a big man), food taste is okay, wait is too long. Well, basically that's what it is, nothing much else to say.  Restaurant is small, therefore if you want a table and don't want to wait too long come early!

My wife and I moved to Charlotte from Jersey not too long ago. When people come to visit, this is the only place we HAVE TO take them. Definitely our go-to soul food spot in the area, hands down! As a matter of fact, we're going to go again tomorrow!!!

My husband and I celebrated our wedding night here. I ordered the whiting, string beans and Mac and cheese. The portions were more than enough. Everything was cooked and seasoned just right. They only have wine and beer there. Please don't look at the chalkboard by the kitchen, that menu is incorrect. I'll definitely order that dish again.
So happy I chose this place for lunch during my day in Charlotte. Fun atmosphere and great food!

Mert's is without a doubt a landmark and plays a role in the historic fabric of charlotte. My recent visit though was not to impressive. The food was decent, although the home fries were raw. Maybe the cook was having a bad day and is off his/her game. I would give this place a try again.

When we first moved to Charlotte, NC from Savannah, I was really looking forward to trying Southern food here. A lot of people suggested Mert's. One word-YUCK! We ordered simple items. Fried chicken, macaroni and cheese and collards. The chicken was tasteless and the mac was bland. The service wasn't great either. She leaned over our table,with her butt in the other patrons face the entire time. Not impressed. I went a second time just in case they were having a bad day. I ordered catfish with okra and tomatoes. Again-YUCK! The catfish was fried too hard and did not have any meat on it. The okra and tomatoes were alright. Still searching for a great southern restaurant.

Service was friendly and down home flavored. Catfish, black eye peas and cabbage was well seasoned.. I also recommend the shrimp Creole. ..lots of green onions. I do not recommend the peach cobbler. That was like eating peach filling on bread.

Overall, this was a good dining experience.  Six of us went for lunch. The service was a little on the slow side but that was understandable considering that it was lunch time. I had whiting, Mac and cheese and collards.  The collards were just ok......not seasoned very well.  The others in my party enjoyed their meal as well.

I wish I could say it was worth the 20-25 min wait, but no. The hostess was quite rude. She sat a group of 4 that came in after my group of 3 and when I asked about it, she said "It's complicated". Seemed simple enough to me. So after waiting patiently, we were then asked to wait " outside". She didn't ask any of the people that came after us, but saw fit to approach the next ones to be seated. At that point I was ready to walk out, but I was with my parents celebrating their 51st wedding anniversary...I didn't want to ruin their night. The food was alright, I've had better.

We ate here during our visit to the Queen City, service and food were amazing. The prices were great, I would recommend everything. At our table we had salmon cakes, mac n cheese, fried chicken and fish, collard greens, cabbage, bbq pork, several desserts and last but not least cornbread. If you get an opportunity stop in and enjoy !

It's been many years since I lasted visited Mert's and although I enjoyed my meal, it seems like something was missing. I ordered whiting, collard greens, yams and it came with a side of cornbread. The yams were runny and the fish tasted just ok. The collards and cornbread were fantastic! I also sampled my dates' mac n' cheese and it tasted just like someone's grandmother made it.

This spot is located downtown charlotte so in a prime location. It was recommended for charlottes black restaurant week. I was super excited to try something new and have some great soul food. Came in no special restaurant week menu I'm use to but rolled with it. The hostess noted 25 percent off combos for the week. We were immediately seated. The table had a large 6 pack sauce holder on the table. Moved it off it took up too much space. Waitress was nice but she wasn't aware of the specials. My friend and I got the catfish with chicken combo. It seemed like a lot of food so we decided to share. It was a decent portion to share if your not famished. The cat fish was salty, the cabbage was bland, the chicken was burnt, and the Mac and cheese was decent. Got a side of red beans which was maybe from the bottom of the pot. They charge extra for corn bread. The price wasn't stated when we placed the order we were asked if we wanted 2 pieces. The corn bread was good. The place had items on the counter that were irrelevant and collecting dust.  So this is soul food in the south....

The Sanitation Score is 90.  The black eyed peas had crunchy grit (like from dirt or sand) The fried chicken was devoid of taste.  I had to pay $3 for parking to just run in and get my to go meal. (Don't bother "validating" the parking card at the restaurant, the cost is still $3) This place is going downhill.

Well smack the dentures right out of your southern grandma's mouth! Just like a old time Sunday dinner in the Deep South! As your ears are filled with music of the soul, R&B, and blues varieties; once your server sets the plate of cornbread loafs on your table, you know you're in for a treat! Yes, cornbread loafs that are sweet and when smothered with the accompanying butter, absolutely delicious! We ordered the salmon patties with Mac n Cheese and green beans! This is not salmon from a can, instead fresh poached salmon that are extremely tasty! The Mac n Cheese was probably baked before serving, and without question the best I've had at a restaurant! The green beans were cooked, no doubt, in some kind of bacon grease presumably. We also had a combination plate of the bbq beef ribs with a fried chicken breast! I'm not a fan of beef ribs, but these were tender and not overpowered by the bbq sauce! The fried chicken was, well, southern fried chicken at its finest! We also tried the candied yams which were cooked perfectly without being too sweet from the brown sugar. The place makes you feel as though your in a diner in Harlem; with the decor and old time soul music blending with the aromas of fresh southern roots! The servers could be a little more attentive, however our redeemed himself after seeing us stop another waitress to ask for refills. I will say that each employee was personable, hospitable, and eager when asked to give you their take on the food and history of this popular spot in downtown Charlotte. As I paid and walked out the door,  passing a street performer doing her best Etta James impersonation, I realized that outside of Harlem you just don't find many places like Mert's! Starting another diet, this Southern Gentleman just had a great meal!

What can I say? It was hands down delicious. I ordered the combo meal of chopped bbq and 2 sides ofmac and cheese and collards. Portions were generous and the flavor was delicious! Service was great our waiter was prompt and had a great attitude. Will look forward to returning if I'm in the area again!

This place reminds me of the diners in New Orleans. Cozy and welcoming with simple food done exceptionally well.   I had the red beans and rice with turkey kielbasa. The portion size was perfect; though if there had been more on my plate, I would have kept on eating. This is the kind of meal that fills you up and warms you from the inside.   My only complaint is the small amount of options for gluten free diners such as myself, though that's relatively common among soul food restaurants. Any chance we can get some GF cornbread? The little loafs are so charming!

Pretty Good Comfort Food For The Soul. I had the beef rib and chicken breast with a side of red beans and collard greens. The staff was nice and I really appreciated the nostalgic images on the wall of historic performers and movie creative.

I bought a Livingsocial deal for Mert's. The place is crowed for brunch on Sat. We were quickly seated. The cornbreads were very delicious and warm. Don't take the cornbread to go because it isn't that good when it is a take out.  I got the salmon cake with two sides mac and cheese and mash potatoe with gravy. The side orders were good sizes. They weren't stingy on the gravy enough for your mash potatoe. My dad had the catfish and the beef ribs. The beef ribs were good but catfish was more on the fishy side. Overall, we enjoyed Mert's. The staffs were all very friendly.The quarter leg was also good. The nice young lady who waited on us was fast and nice. It was a busy day and she even remembered to refill my drink. If you work at downtown, give Mert's a try.

I love Merts! Not too greasy, not too salty, just right.  This place is better for small parties, not big ones.  I've been with both, the food is still good, but you will have a better experience. Everything is good, go as frequently as you can to try it all lol.

On a short layover in Charlotte, we wanted to have a taste of the town since we'd never been here before.  My better half was really craving fried chicken, and we wanted something well-rated, non-chain, and definitely local.  Enter Mert's.  It's located among the Queen City's tallest downtown skyscrapers, which really impressed the kids as we walked a couple blocks from affordable parking.  Yup, you read right - no on-site parking, short of what's available on the street, when it's allowed.  The place is jam-stuffed with character by way of miscellaneous framed pictures, signs, old Americana, and even hanging bicycles.  The wall even has an interesting blended/faded paint job on it - really nice!  We were promptly ushered to a table, provided menus and drinks, and kindly assisted with a tour of the menu and food options after we introduced ourselves as Charlotte and Mert's first-timers.  I ordered a fried chicken leg quarter with sides of collard greens and yams.  My bride went with salmon cakes, and sides of mac & cheese and mashed potatoes.  Kid #1 had chicken fingers, and #2 had grilled cheese.  Before dinner arrived, we were served two plates with two large servings of cornbread each.  The bread was steaming hot, and hit the bullseye on very straight-forward cornbread.  Tasty!  Dinner arrived and, as we always do, wifey and I partook family-style, trading bites of everything between us.  Overall, everything was good at worst, and a couple items were amazing!  Unfortunately, in our opinion, the fried chicken fell into the former category.  Don't get me wrong - it was tasty, the meat was moist, the skin crispy.  It's just that it seemed to lack seasoning - even basic salt and/or pepper.  And, admittedly, my expectation for chicken joints is that the chicken be outstanding and a bit different.  Not just well-executed plain fried chicken.    However, the salmon cakes and all the sides were fantastic.  This was only the second time I've had collard greens, and Mert's were the better of the two I've had.  Not only that, but I'd say it was the best thing I tasted on this occasion!  Also really, really good were the yams and the salmon cakes.  Service was better than average, and very friendly.  Also, all four of us left stuffed like turkeys on the big day, and for a very reasonable cost.  Great value.  Charlotte did right by us for our first taste of her riches!  We hope to return again soon!  Food = 4/5  Facility = 3/5 Service = 4/5 Ambiance = 4/5 Value = 4/5

Seriously... this place is pretty wonderful!  I love the taste of the food, the service is excellent, and love the decor.  It reminds me of small places in Harlem.  The food is super delicious and the sizes are just right... filling if you are super hungry and choices for the not so hungry folks.  The prices are very reasonable, and frankly you cannot beat that in the Uptown Charlotte area.  Why not the fifth star?  Well because I feel that it's missing calillou, and island drinks, like sorrell.  If they made things like that, then it would be a perfect 5 stars.  I would love to see fried okras on the menu as well.  Even with all of these things that they do not have... they do have some super yummy things... Try their Sweet Potatoe Souffle!  Oh my goodness that is freakin' awesome!!!  It's like... sweet veggies and dessert all at the same time!  Super awesome!    Care for some soul food?  Definitely go to Mert's!

Living downtown for over 6 years my family and friends have dined here very often. The food is good, prices very reasonable. I consciously support local businesses. Last night my husband and I decided to call in an order at 8:40 we were told 15 min we didn't arrive to pick up food until 9:00pm. I walked in and stood at front desk for at least 10 min BEFORE ANYONE ACKNOWLEDGED I saw waitress hurrying pass helping customers etc.I waited eventually a server in a purple shirt not sure if different colors represent positions comes over I tell her the name she looks around goes and gets my food from kitchen I check bag everything was there she takes bag back places on table behind cash register then walks away . I'm standing there confused another server notices me comes over ask do I need any help and I'm like yes I want to check out and for the inconvenience of me standing for now 15 min for a slice of cake he obliged as he returned with A SLICE of cake purple shirt hurries says"what you think your doing ,he says some words pretty low she Snatches cake and says did you ask kiona. I'm like umm is kiona manager. purple shirt leaves now I'm livid, embarrassed still hungry etc.A server comes over in red shirt ask how can she help I explain I've been standing here for 20 min I called in my order over 35 min ago she Goes through my bag  again. Now I'm feeling upset why is everyone checking the food .She says the reason it took so long is because A MANAGER TOOK MY PHONE ORDER AND ONLY SHE CAN CHECK ME OUT AND SHE IS BUSY WHAT are you serious but she has PERMISSION to do so now. I couldn't understand the protocol. Why answer phone .This was upsurd. I said can you ask the manager for a slice of cake. NOT FREE DINNERS she comes back and says mysterious manager said NO if she gave me a slice everyone would need one .As a business owner I understand that my clients need to feel heard, appreciated and respected a $4 slice WAS THIS SERIOUS .MY husband came in because it was now close yup 30 min of me walking into the place. He also owns a business in Charlotte and has brought many clients to Merts he told me he no longer wanted to pay for the meal that we will patronage another business in which we did and called in , food was ready, we were greeted with respect. THANKS "Dish". If Merts can't handle busy hours, understaffed etc.IT IS NEVER THE CUSTOMERS RESPONSIBILTY. Disappointed that I can no longer support a rude establishment. My time and money are valuable and not to be treated any differently. The young guy with light braids should be a manager he knows how to calmly find solutions however he didn't have control over this situation and neither did I.

Had high hopes but was a bit disappointed. Greens did not seem cooked (were tough) and did not have good flavor (ended up sending them back after one bite). The macaroni didn't taste "homemade either" tasted like boxed macaroni with cheese placed on top and then baked and even that was baked too hard. The shrimp Po Boy was pretty good, shrimp was seasoned well and not over cooked... bread was good but could've been softer. Highlight was the lemon cake!!! If I returned I'd stick to the sandwich and cake and skip the sides.
First time here. Salmon cakes were good, I had too high expectations they would taste like mom's.
Great fried chicken! love their fresh, fully veg collard greens! the mac and cheese is the good ol' Southern country style. Always fresh, always fast. Highly recommend this place.

Leave it to my Yelp family to send me to the best spots when I'm traveling. I came to Charlotte for a conference and decided to check Mert's out with a bunch of my colleagues. In short, we loved it!  Cornbread: I've never been a huge cornbread fan, but this cornbread had me wanting more and more! It was soooooooo hot and delicious!  Jumbo wings: You get three with the meal. Fried perfectly. Delicious. Delicious. Delicious.  Mac & Cheese: I can't seem to find decent mac & cheese out west so I wait until I come back East to get my fix. This mac & cheese was all things perfect! Two thumbs up.  Collard greens: This was my least favorite dish. While I appreciated that they weren't overlooked, they were really vinegary. I wasn't a fan.  Sweet potato cake: I had never heard of such a delicacy. I figured since I love sweet potatoes and I'm a fan of cake, this would hit the spot! I think it needed more butter though as it was really dry.  Overall, a must visit place when you're in Charlotte!

It's OK.  It's soul food.  The fried chicken was straight forward.  Not likely to go back for just that, as Price's is much better in my opinion.    I was also able to sample the BBQ pork... It was a tad weird.  My girlfriend accurately pointed out it tasted like curry.   I would steer clear of that.   The mac and cheese was good because, let's be honest, it's cheese and cheese is good.  The collards were authentic and would get them again.    Our server was very nice and attentive.    Overall rating - Just an OK.

Great price, great food and great service. I had the Jumbo wing dinner that was accompanied by (slap yo momma) mac n cheese and collard greens. I wasn't particularly thrilled about the collard greens but they were played nicely and taste fresh. I will be back again!!!

Giving Merts 2 stars for their BRUNCH only. I recently visited Mert's for a brunch date and was so excited. I ordered the French toast with the western omelette and home fries. The French toast was okay but the omelette is another story. Their white cheddar cheese had absolutely no flavor and neither did anything on the omelette. My date ordered fish and grits (the fish was okay) but since the water Merts uses tastes bitter, so did the grits. I hope they get a filter for their water as it is disgusting.   When I mentioned it to the waitress, she added that she's heard the complaint before. LOL It's really difficult to mess up a breakfast and I am so sorry to say Mert's did.
