The beef ribs were not quite what I was expecting or really would have ordered if I had known.  They were the short kind - and in this case, emphasis on short.  There was very little meat on them. The BBQ sauce was too vinegary for my tastes, just ok.  The catfish was solid, but again, when I was eating it I still didn't understand the hype.  The collards were the best part of the meal (delicious take on a classic), and the Mac and cheese was good too, though under seasoned.   My partner had the salmon cakes, which were very good.  I don't remember what else she had, but this aspect was memorable and quite good.  We both had cake for dessert, which again were good but not outstanding.  The atmosphere is cool here. I like the bright colors and the VERY friendly and courteous wait staff.  You can tell they want their customers to be happy, but the food just wasn't that great, so I can't go above 3 stars for now.  We may try mert's again, so we'll see.
had no problem with the street parking.  service was prompted, courteous, and great.  food is yummy, portion is large.  price's right.  will come back!

I enjoyed my experience at Mert's. Having a soul food restaurant in Uptown really shows the variety of options. Again, with friends we visited and the place was packed. It's not the largest restaurant, but it has lots of charm. The place had photos all over the wall and some interesting art too. I was mostly taken by the counter of cakes. They had at least 10 on the counter for you to choose from. I picked out the cake I wanted before I ordered my food. I had the fried catfish, black eyed peas, cole slaw and macaroni and cheese. I enjoyed everything except the macaroni and cheese. I also had cornbread, which was great. I had to stop eating it before my food came out or I would have been full. Ok, the best part of it all was the Banana Pudding Cake. Initially, I wanted the Banana Pudding, but they were out, so the next best thing is Banana Pudding Cake. It was highly recommended from our waitress and it didn't disappoint. It's a must try. All the cakes looked delicious. The food is reasonably priced too. The restaurant is in the city, so parking is available in different lots or garages and you can walk. Overall, I enjoyed it!

One extra star for service. As for the food, I have definitely had better. Fried Chicken was decent, but the pulled pork had a little too much fat in it (at lease 1/3 was chunks of fat), I can only take so much. Squash salad, candied sweet potato, and okra & tomato sides were decent. The sweet potato cake with cream cheese frosting was excellent but might be too rich and sweet for some.

I have eaten at Mert's quite a few times over the years, but this was my first visit in a while.  I'm glad to say that things are as good as ever!  I had the salmon cakes, which were absolutely fantastic. Very fresh, well seasoned and tasty. I loved the slightly spicy remoulade that is provided for the extra kick. All entrees come with cornbread, and it does not disappoint. It makes for a nice starter as you await your meal.  For my sides, I had the acorn squash and the potato salad- both were magnificent. I had to try the acorn squash because it was such a unique thing to find on a menu. I hope this is done as a special side on a regular basis. It was so tender that I even ate the skin! The potato salad should satisfy any fans of the traditional southern variety.   Service was friendly and efficient and the price was certainly reasonable.  Keep up the good work!

Um...I walked in there and walked right back out. I will never ever eat there.Their Health Inspection score is an 84...f*cking disgusting  their inspection history: 84 93 90 93 94 90 94 87.5 91  Gross. They're obviously not keen on keeping a clean restaurant.  If you're the type of person that says, "oh I don't look at that kind of stuff"...you should. You REALLY should.

I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN! This was my second time eating here and while the food is not terrible, it's not the best and is way overprice for mediocre. First time I had fried chicken and I honestly can say that Bojangles is by far better. This time I had the shrimp creole and rice and it was not bad but doesn't stand out. The rice was bland and the dish over all had no spice. If you have a party over 4 eating here, forget it because they only have seating for 4 and no good accommodations for larger parties. I had a party of 6 this time and it took OVER AN HOUR for us to be seated. I had visiting family and they tried to sit us at separate tables?? NOT GOOD ENOUGH MERTS! Now the part that any restaurant should have is good customer service and today, their host was extremely poor, rude and had a major attitude problem! This is unacceptable for ANY RESTAURANT! My recommendation is to go elsewhere and save yourself the trouble!
Food is crazy good. It was like I was back at my grandmothers house. And the service was great they definitely know how to take care of you. A must go is you are looking for soul food

Had dinner last night here. The food left a lot to be desired. Reputation aside the salmon cakes had no seasoning and the ribeye was tough. Really disappointing. I've been here before when I come to Charlotte and had better food. Hopefully, this was a one-off.

Pretty good soul food at decent prices. The service was eh. It was not busy during our visit.  The fried chicken and chicken wings were was ok, not as crisp as I like. The green beans were very good.  We waited forever, almost walked out before we received a waitress. Mac n cheese was good.  The food was reasonably priced and I would return and give them another shot.

I came last Saturday on a whim. I had been passing this place on my walks around the area. Seeing all those people buzzing in there enticed me. It didn't take long to be seated, considering how many people were in there. I ordered fried chicken ( breast and wing), macaroni and cheese, and red beans with a lemonade. Mistakenly, they brought wings and I immediately alerted the waitress. Then, I received my order. Everything except for the red beans was scrumptious. For dessert, I selected German chocolate cake. It was not extravagantly delicious but nice. Next time, I'll get for my sides macaroni and cheese with potato salad, then finish with yellow cake and chocolate icing.

We have a ton of soul food places in the DMV, none with the customer service as high as Mert's. Although it was a rainy day when we went, we were immediately seated and greeted upon our initial walk in. I heard about Mert's through one of those food network shows I typically watch which review various markets around the United States. I called in advanced and inquired about the wait time and the receptionist kindly said come on in....there is no wait at the current moment. According to the tv show and the reviews posted the soul rolls are a must try. I will not argue that point at all. As most have noted the food is really good but it's not big mamas house but if your craving down home cooking Mert's will do.....when the bill came it was $70 bucks for 4 people with appetizers and take home desserts. In DC this woulda ran me over $100 bucks so I gladly paid this with no complaint. Thanks Mert's for not charging for lemonade refills like some souls food places feel their entitled to do...the only suggestions and reason I could not give this place 5 stars is it did not have a changing table for my mini me which made for a rather interesting duper change lol...peep the pic, I will come again, hopefully my kids in pull-ups by then lol

Delicious!  We were looking for a quick spot for dinner and wanted something local to Uptown Charlotte - and we almost passed on this because we didn't know how long the food would take - but so glad we went! Really good southern soul food (I got fried catfish, yams, and collards).  Fantastic atmosphere - decorations and vibe are great.  Quick service! And the cornbread they brought out for free before our meal was really yummy. If you're visiting the area - def stop here!

I tired this place because people raved about their food. So I finally decide to try their food on Sunday. When we arrived the hostess was very unpleasant. She told us that the wait was going to be 45 minutes, which was odd because they had three tables that needed to be cleaned and only two people ahead of us. When we were seated the waitress was sweat at first. She explained to us that the catfish wasn't her favorite but the chicken was ok. (It's great when your staff really doesn't have that much to rave on). When our food arrived, my collard greens had tomatoes and onions. I had asked for the collards to be plain. I told the young guy that my order was incorrect. He huffed and took my plate away. The person I was with, asked the server for gravy. We asked someone in the restaurant to bring us gravy because our server was no where to be found. As we asked him for the gravy, he asked us to move our purses so that he could use one of the inside chairs.......Are you serious. 20 minutes later, the server came back and said, "Oh, he never brought it?" After that she never came back to check on us, until it was time for us to pay. I would never go back to this place. The service was terrible and the food was not all that great.

I have lived in Charlotte for awhile and never visited Mert's. I purchased a Groupon. Today was first and last visit. They try to pass the cornbread off as homemade. It's not. The collard greens were tough and salty and the blackened salmon was greasy. Plus the waitress was rude. Nobody in my lunch party enjoyed their meal.

Amazing meal. I got the beef rib and fried chicken which were both outstanding. For sides I got the collard greens and cabbage, also great. And to top it off, the cornbread was delicious! Great service too!

This place is pretty good. They cornbread really is all that.  I came here with a friend and ordered the salmoncake as an appetizer, catfish, okra and slaw.  Since I feel that my entree was only a bit above average I'd rate this 3 stars.  For a soul food place this I would definitely come back for the salmon cake and cornbread.  I enjoyed my food and the portions. The waitstaff was helpful and very friendly.  It was an overall pleasant place to have dinner.

I had high expectations considering that I was in the South.  I love the food in the South!  However the experience here was not very good!    I grew up eating most of the food on the menu, and I tend to make strong comparisons against that home cooking.  In addition, I love food, and I have a wide taste bud ranging from various regions of the world.  The food was delivered to me at my table very very very very very hot.  I was unable to comfortably eat for approx. 7 to 10 minutes.   I ordered Fried Chicken, Greens, Yams, Catfish, and Banana Pudding.  The previous day, my business colleague order and ate the red beans and rice.  Service was good.  The menu needs help.  1) The Fried Chicken wasn't really fried.  It looked like baked chicken that was dried out.  Not crispy looking, not seasoned. Not very tasty. 2) The Catfish was a complete fish with bones.  The taste was pretty good! However, I would have enjoyed it more had I not had to de-bone every bite. 3) The Greens were good! 4) Yams were good! 5) Corn bread was just ok 6) Banana Pudding was very good! 7) Red beans rice and sausage was not good.  All and all, the Merts was just ok,  However, if in town again, I would not be compelled to re-visit...and I love Soul Food.

If your having a taste for soul food this a place to go. I've been here a few times and the food has never disappointed me. For the price point their portions are well off, enough for me to finish the rest the next day.  I recommend the fried chicken, catfish, yams and mac-n-cheese. I have always gone during slower to times so I've had quick service. The servers here are down to earth and tentative, but if you come here it's just for good food and laughs in my eyes. Be sure to visit this place at least once.

Always have a good experience whenever I go. I try no to go when there is large crowds because service can get light due to being overwhelmed. The food is always on point. I do like there side of collard greens with the fried Chicken or fried fish. The Carrot cake is really good.

This place was quick and good. We needed a quick place to eat before going to the bc music factory so stopped here being on tv food maps. The server was nice and very quick service. Not to mention was pretty cheap. I normally don't know cornbread but here it's awesome! Just a little sweetness to it. We also got the fried green tomatoes, I liked them because I prefer restaurants that use cornmeal and they did, I suggest to ask for some extra sauce they drizzle on top. If it friend chicken, mashed potatoes with gravy and Mac and cheese. Overall pretty standard soul food, to be honest it was good but wasn't the best I've ever had for all three items. The chicken was a large portion and the gravy could have used a little more flavor. Overall pretty good for a quick bite to eat.
If you want to get no service go sit outside. Food is deep fried so not for everyone.

This is a great gem in our city. It's uptown in the heart of Charlotte. I wouldn't bring a party of 10 because it's not that large on the inside, or if you do I would call ahead to find out if they're busy at the time or not. It's kind of earthy on the inside as far as the walls and floors. The menu is definitely southern inspired. It's a mixture of "the south" & creole. I had the blackened salmon with rice and greens beans. I absolutely loved everything! My friends had the macaroni and cheese and it was the next best thing to your mother's. The Cornbread is buttermilk made...not hot water! The bread will fill you early so eat it last if you can. The only con is the tip is included in your bill. Our waitress wasn't as attentive as she should have been. She would get your request and walk away before you could finish with something else. I guess since the tip is included she didn't care, but she still had a great attitude. Maybe she was overwhelmed. Nevertheless you will enjoy your food!

This place was pretty cramped, and not a 4 star restaurant by any means...basic menu...I got the chicken breast and collard greens and sweet potatoes. ..the best part of the meal was the cornbread. My chicken was dry, with a lack of seasoning and my greens tasted greasy..like someone didn't drain the fat off of them or something. ..not the best place to get soul food in my opinion.

Okay, the food is pretty good especially their sides but the I ordered the catfish and it was pretty bland which is a bummer. Our server forgot my meal and never bought it back but the good thing was I ended up getting my meal comped since my meal didn't come until we got our checks--I was with a large group so I'm sure they were just off a little. My favorite sides are the candies yams, cabbage, and the Mac and cheese!!

Yes the salmon cakes are definitely a attraction and the fried chicken is da bomb! I took my girl there and she can cook and even she was excited about this food I just called her and we are going there to nite she jumped at the chance of returning to this heavenly mecca of culinary delights wow and the Greens and all the sides wow baked Mac and cheese to die for !!! The meatloaf is better than moms shhh don't tell mom!¡! And the place is cool a lot of soulful singers record albums on the wall and a lot of eclectic all da wall stuff on the walls not fancy dress just right with a mixed crowd of cool people and just ask your waitperson why the foods so good and they just beam you owe it to yourself to go experience this soul food mecca of culinary delights....

Not as good as I expected. We were instantly seated and ordered our food. It took a long time to get the food and the wrong things came out. We waited forever for the correct items. And then waited forever again for the server to return...then forever once more to pay/get cards back.  The food was average. Nothing special.

I miss Mert's. Well, I guess I miss good southern food in general, and, to me, Mert's is why. Granted, I love my Bojangles, Cookout, various BBQ joints, calabash and all. But, whenever I head back to Charlotte, I make it a point to hit up Mert's at least once, if not three times.   I usually get the fried catfish with mashed potatoes and collard greens. The catfish is fried to perfection, nice and crisp without being overly oily or heavy, and the cooks make sure to leave the fins and tail on for those customers that really know how to eat fish. The mashed are made from real potatoes, and the collards are very flavorful, kissed with just the right amount of vinegar. And of course, I always gotta have a loaf or two of the absolute best cornbread in the world. There's a reason why the above is listed as my last meal on earth, and given the portions, I may just be able to delay that inevitable end by a good half hour. The portions are HUGE!  There's nothing on the menu I wouldn't try. There are some definite "safe" items, especially for breakfast. But, if you're just starting your southern cooking career, the fried chicken is excellent as are the shrimp and grits, which aren't really my cup of tea, although that sweet tea now... Service is good, warm and friendly just like service usually is everywhere in the South. There might be a wait at lunch, but given the good weather in Charlotte, you can usually grab a seat on the sidewalk pretty quick.   I'm sure there are better, more authentic spots for southern food. But, for visitors to Charlotte, or those looking for something a little more chic, and sitll new to Southern cooking outside of KFC, a stop at Mert's is absolutely mandatory.

I thought I'd avoid the crowd by dining a little late but the place was PACKED! I love the look and feel of the restaurant although it was a bit warm inside. I asked for a table outside and had my pick...probably a little chilly for some but just right for me.   Sweet tea and a corn bread CAKE were brought out right away. It was the size of a small pound cake and I knew I was in for trouble! I ordered the salmon cakes, greens and mac & cheese. Salmon cakes had lost their crispness on the outside, but the flavor was delicious. The greens were leafy and large and JUST RIGHT! And god bless the mac & cheese. Oozing with buttery cheesy goodness and a touch of the topping that had baked up brown and I may as well have died and gone to heaven.  Of course I could not finish all the food. But my server offered a box without my asking. Great food and great service.

I'm good!  When you have a veggie section on the menu and indicate what is cooked with animal fat(1 item), that's a big plus for me. All the meat eaters seemed to be pleased with portions and seasonings.   Oh!  I had collared greens, red beans, okra an tomatoes with cornbread on the side. Good stuff.    Customers walked in until close and were being served. Last observation; a lot clean plates. Veggie and meat eaters with find something grub on. Check it out when in Charlotte. Peace

If you don't know anything about soul food, it tastes good. If you've had real home cooked soul food and are looking to replicate the experience, this is not the place to go. On the contrary, the staff was friendly and approachable.

I went to the Epicenter in Uptown Charlotte today for the first time. Looking to have a nice lunch, I was unimpressed with the options within the complex. A quick search on Yelp turned up Mert's. Southern soul food sounded fantastic!  I didn't leave disappointed. We were able to quickly get a table during lunch hour. I thought the service was exceptional, even though one of my items were wrong, but it was handled well.  My favorite part had to be getting a huge piece of corn bread while waiting for the meal. The fried chicken leg quarter I had was definitely top notch. The fried catfish fillet needed more seasoning, but the Cajun tartar sauce made up for that. My sides of mashed potatoes and mac/cheese were alright.  I'd definitely say a 4/5 meal, 5/5 service, and 4/5 prices. Try this place out if you're near the Epicenter, only a 4 minute walk!

Great interior.  Visited on a Thursday night.  Original server, who took our orders, seemed great, but was quickly replaced by a second server who seemed rather surly.  Order details were not passed along - such as a request for lettuce, tomato, and mayo my sandwich.  Then, instead of coming to the table to pick up our credit cards for payment, she wanted us to pass them to her while she stood at the register next to the table ~smh~ Much too informal with that.    BBQ was great.  Mac and cheese pretty good.

I had the pleasure of taking a coworker to Mert's for her first time today. We had an amazing lunch! The place was packed but we didn't have to wait. The waitresses were super busy with big parties who were there for their Sunday afternoon meals but were no less charming and friendly.  I've been once before and I highly recommend the Fried Green Tomato appetizer that I had last time. The chicken is excellent as is the cornbread. I had Salmon Cakes today and they were out of this world! The mac and cheese is delicious as are the greens and green beans. I could have drank a gallon of their sweet tea but I'm glad I stuck with two. We shared a piece of German Chocolate Cake for dessert. I was good and the whipped cream on the side just melted in my mouth.  I don't know why I waited so long to make a return visit but trust me, I'm going to make it a priority to get back there soon!

Mert's is AWESOME. Now I might be biased because I LOVE southern cookin, but this place does it right!!!  Their cornbread is the best I've had anywhere.  No lie.  And their fried chicken blows Price's Chicken Coop out of the water.  Check out the menu before you go and if you like the type of food they serve, you're going to love Mert's.

For southern comfort food, you can't go wrong. My favorite is the Andouille sausage beans and rice. The homemade cornbread is great as well. This has been around for a long time so they must be doing something right!

Was excited to go here after having been recommended it by one of the locals and also due to it being on DD&D.  Our server was very nice and friendly and the best part of this place.   Our brunch took 25-30 minutes to come out during non-busy hours. A very long wait just for breakfast food.  The food itself was not special. Nothing stood out. My girlfriend ordered a fried chicken dish and honestly Bojangles is better and it's cheaper and fast food.  It's also pretty dirty and the bathroom is disgusting.   Save your money and go somewhere else. I have no idea how this place made it on DD&D.

It gets points for not being a chain, because Charlotte has turned into a city of chains. Honestly, overall the food was terribly bland. It is a decent spot to check out for soul food, but not my number one recommendation. I will say that the cornbread was phenomenal, like best ever level cornbread, but that was where the meal deliciousness ended. My chicken just tasted like fryer grease and was extremely greasy and more burnt than crisp (everyone else at the table that got the fried chicken felt the same). The yams were over the top sweet, more like a dessert and swimming in sauce and the collards really didn't have any taste at all, and were at the point of over cooked. I will say that our server was wonderful and very pleasant, which helped the dining experience. Overall, I'm glad we checked out this place, but I don't think we will be back.

After seeing Mert's featured on the Food Network, I was super excited about visiting this place while visiting Charlotte. I arrived on a Saturday during lunch hour and was seated within 10 minutes. Our server was not friendly nor attentive the entire time but she did have a few parties in addition to my table of 2. It took about 20 minutes before we even got our drinks. By the time she was ready to take our order, we decided to put our entire order in all at the same time so our entrees came well before our appetizers. Once we were ready to go, it took about 15 minutes for our check to be delivered. I know the place was busy but they really need to improve on their customer service.   Now for the take on food. Let me preference that I'm from the South and grew up eating and cooking Soul/Southern food my entire life so I may be a little bias.  Appetizers We ordered the Soul Rolls which were amazing. Black eyed peas, collard greens, chicken and rice egg roll style. They are unique and very tasty.  They also give you complementary cornbread which is pretty good. I think they must use sour cream with the mix because it had a more tangy flavor.    Entrees My boyfriend ordered Shrimp and Grits. He enjoyed the dish but definitely has had better. The Roux was very bland and the grits were a little overcooked.  I ordered the Fried catfish plate with macaroni & cheese and collard greens. My catfish was good but both my sides lacked flavor. The macaroni & cheese tasted like off brand cheese mixed with heavy butter.  My collard greens was way too salty. I've had better greens from a can of Glory.  Overall - I think a must try is the Soul Rolls for sure. All the other food seems very commercial and lacks flavor. And you must be willing to overlook the horrible service as well.

This place serves excellent Low Country/Country Cooking dishes at reasonable prices - at least the prices are reasonable at lunch, $7 - $9 for a entree which comes with 2 sides and corn bread.  The Fried Chicken is excellent, The Ribs are as well, and I love the Salmon Cakes. The Fried Catfish is good, any of the Po' Boys are worth trying. The Fried Green Tomato app is nice, not as tart as some, but still good. The Collards are not to my liking, and  I've tried them twice.  The Shrimp and Grits are nice, rich and creamy. But, I was disappointed in the Shrimp Creole, was bland and watery. Service here is excellent, even when this place is busy, which it always seems to be. The ambiance is homey, though it can get a little loud.

I visited Charlotte last week and I ate here three times.  I couldn't help it.    Soul Food is right.  Eating here is like having a spiritual revival meeting in your mouth.  You feel like a better person after having eaten here.  A better person who will die of a massive heart attack in 5 minutes.
Amazing soul food in the heart of downtown Charlotte.  Fun atmosphere, warm and hospitable service. Generous portions. Everything was fantastic.

Tried this place for the first time when I visited charlotte last year. Fast forward and I'm back again a year later. Had a vibe that the food portions got a bit smaller since, or just unlucky night? Who knows.   Service was a bit slow when I went in Friday night and our food was sitting out for like 5-10 mins before it was actually brought out to us. Just gonna go ahead and call it an unlucky night, food was delicious tho.

This is my second visit to Mert's (the first time Yelp wouldn't let me be great and check in). They decor is artisy and eclectic and includes a diner style dessert counter. (My inner fatty girl rejoices) if you are on one of those "starve myself of carbs because they are the devil" diets do yourself a favor and skip this place because the cornbread is a MUST!   I got the fried jumbo chicken wings which were delicious, the greens, which were flavorful but not very juicy like I prefer mine. The only disappointment from my meal were my yams. Basically because I had more juice than potato :-(   Staff was friendly and attentive. I'll definitely be returning for some banana pudding.

The service here sucks. We went there and they got us the main meal before the appetizer and bread.  When I requested to have my appetizer first, the waitress replied that they are expecting lots of people from the convention and they are trying to get us out as fast as possible. I immediately left.   Never going to go back again.
Best soul food in Charlotte. Other than the clogged arteries, nothing to complain about. The cornbread is amazing by the way, probably the most memorable part of my meal.

Wow. This place is excellent!  I grew up in Charlotte and sadly, never discovered this place until after I moved away. I heard a couple of great recommendations, and my family decided to try it out.   The meal starts out with some outstanding cornbread, so buttery it seems light and almost melts in your mouth. We also got a fried green tomato appetizer, which was really good. Between the four of us we had 2 orders of salmon cakes (delish), fried chicken, and ribs, and probably one of each of the sides. I would definitely recommend the salmon cakes again, fried chicken and ribs are a bit heavy for me but my dad and brother went to town. Everything was really good and made me lament living so far away from good southern cookin'.  Then there was dessert. While my mom, brother and I were unbuttoning the top button of our pants and trying to make a little bit more room, my dad was going strong. We ended up with a slice of sweet potato cake (divine!) and a slice of coconut cake to take home for later. The waitress told us that all of the cakes are made by a woman in her home, and we could just imagine what her house must smell like...   Our server was super friendly and comfortable; she was really nice but not in the kind of way where she was trying too hard.   Love love loved it. I will look forward to coming back on each visit home!

Super friendly service and very quick! Food was good (i had the southern sampler). Cornbread was A+ I just wish the ventilation was a little better inside, but if you don't mind smelling like fried food, then all around, this place is wonderful!! :-)

Well, I was disappointed. I read a few mixed reviews before visiting this restaurant, which came highly recommended from my sister. This seems to be a "hit or miss" establishment. I had beef ribs, Mac & cheese, and collard greens. The BBQ sauce on the beef ribs was rather unique, not to my liking. The collard greens were disgusting. They are vinegar based. They aren't chopped up so I essentially had a bowl of vinegar based collard leaves. The fried chicken while plain was the best part of my meal with a little Texas Pete added.   I ordered the salmon patties as an appetizer. They were highly recommended. They were heavily peppered and was another dish not tailored to my liking.   It took about 30+ minutes to receive our food. Unfortunately, this will be my first and last time visiting this establishment.   (My sister would like me to note that this was a visit at night, allegedly there food is better before dusk)

Let me first say how delicious the cornbread was!  The catfish that I  ordered was a fillet with a lot of batter on it although it was seasoned nice it was just to much breading for me ( and i thought i was going to get the whole fish not the fillet). The yams were out of a can so that was a major let down. The mac and cheese was not to my liking at all it tasted like it was made with velvetta and other cheap cheeses.The fried chicken was lightly fried and not crispy either but the collard greens were well seasoned.  Seems like a tourist spot to me. The staff was friendly and I liked the crowd I didn't get a chance to try the homemade cakes although they looked pretty tasty.  I can at least say that I tried this place :)

Stopped at Merts on the recommendation of a client while visiting Charlotte. The food was pretty good, though not nearly as good as soul food I've had in other places. The collard greens were very good, but the fried chicken was a bit dry. I didn't come in with high expectations so I wasn't extremely let down, but I've definitely had better sold food at other  places.

Collard Greens were some of the best I've had.  Fried chicken was yummy, but the quarter (breast & wing) was too big to pick up and eat with my fingers.  Doing the knife & fork thing took some of the joy out of having my way with this guilty pleasure.  Homey  comfort food in a warm, friendly environment.

We came on a Thursday evening and ordered the fried chicken breast with BBQ beef ribs, 2 sides: mac and cheese and mashed potatoes and a heineken for 20  - Come b4 8 to beat the wait! - Friendly waitress. Gave great recommendations.  - Excellent cornbread...so goood! nom nom!  - Average chicken. It's no Roscoe's. EllaEm's in LV is better. crispy juicy fail.  - A bone with no meat on my plate. rib fail. - Beef was not as tender as I would have hoped for. No mind-blowing flavor - Ordered a side of home fries but it was pending even after I finished my meal! lol - Home fries are not fries. It's more like chopped potatoes. Good thing I cancelled my order - Expensive heineken. Just get a Carolina.

Loved our waitresses!  They were fun and personal with attitude!  Food was so so. The BBQ ribs were small beef short ribs with a thin vinegar based sauce.  The Mac n cheese was the best!  The collard greens were hard and vinegar based.  The peach cobbler was just so so.  Atmosphere ans waitresses are the best part of the restaurant.
Not a fan of anything here. I have tried the food here on several occassions and just dont see how people keep going there. Soul food with no soul.... thats my take on it.
Went to Merts on Saturday for the first time and wasn't to enthused. I have a heart for fried chicken but it was just ok. Great customer service but ok on the food.

I am definitely a fan - it is quirky, eclectic, and fun to visit, although it is a bit on the smaller side. The soul rolls are pretty much everything, and their fried chicken/mac and cheese is delicious. It is incredibly affordable, and there are just enough options without being overwhelming. One of my favorite casual dining establishments.

Went to Mert's on Friday and was absolutely dying to try their Salmon Cakes! Needless to say I did Not get to. It was a group of 3 and we opted to sit outside since it was comfortable. We were sat at the first outdoor table and the gentleman left after seating us. We looked over the menu and had all decided on what we wanted. We waited 32 minutes and still not a single person employed by Mert's bothered to ask us about a drink let alone any type of service.  I was beyond put off by this and thought it to be very unprofessional!  They were Not that busy at all. There were plenty of waiters and waitresses standing around talking and even the gentleman that sat us was just sitting down gabbing with another employee.  We will NEVER go back again. As a small family owned business like Mert's you strive for customer satisfaction,  I know this all too well. As a small business owner myself I continuously look to support other small businesses but obviously my standards are far exceeding that of Mert's standards. Such a shame.

My mother and I decided to check this place out one afternoon in Charlotte. Please don't waste your time, money, and patience visiting this establishment! The service is absolutely dreadful and the food is mediocre at best!

Had the chicken wings with okra and mac and cheese....my friend was right when he said the food was overrated. Completely bland wings and mac and cheese was pretty much cheese-less except the top. However, the okra was good and so was the cornbread. Not worth the money though.

The worst customer service by server and manager. We've been coming here for years. Tonight's experience is one of the worst restaurant experiences I've ever had. Supposedly there was a computer error with our food. Fine, I understand it happens sometimes. However while waiting two hours, we repeatedly asked our server about our dinner. We got the same response every time. "It'll be right up." He did not consider actually checking on the food. All the tables around us came, ate and left. Meanwhile, our server could not even remember to bring water to the table without being asked multiple times.   After I stopped asking nicely about our food, the server finally went to inquire. The manager offered to comp two beers for waiting two hours if we wanted to just  leave. How generous. Otherwise she offered to discount our meals and offered us what we thought was another round of beers. She did not even follow through on that promise. We were given one free beer each. Pathetic. Over 80% of the restaurant was filled with people from our convention. People who make it a point to dine here every time we come.   The server never apologized. Nor did he bother to even clear our plates.  There are plenty of other places to spend your money where it will be appreciated.

Portions were huge. Corn bread was one the best I have had. Sweet tea was good, just right. Server was very polite and responsive. Had fried chicken,  macn cheese and collards. All needed more flavor.

Where to begin...  Even the bread and butter served to each table is utterly delicious! Located conveniently in the downtown, Uptown, the restaurant exuded southern hospitality. The smell of fried everything wafted from the kitchen. Sign posters on the walls showed pretty much every stage actor ever had stopped in. And the staff was friendly as could be.  As for the food, there was absolutely nothing that feel short of expectations. Fried tomatoes, mmm mmm mmm! Green beans cooked in delicious country ham juices. Fried Chicken, salivating good!  Our waitress kept emphasizing desserts. We went ahead and got some strawberry shortcake, a sweet explosion of flavor later, we exited satisfied, with smiles on our faces, and about 5 pounds heavier.

This was my first time eating at Mert's restaurant and I enjoyed the food.  My sister and I live in the beautiful city of Charlotte and we decided to go on a brother-sister date at Merts!  I ordered the southern fried chicken with Mac and cheese and cabbage. My sister ordered blackened pork chop with Okra & tomatoes and Mac and cheese.... MmmMmmmmMmmm... Finger sucking delicious!!!  I'll be back with some co-workers. I was looking for a good soul food restaurant in Charlotte for a while and I found it!

Came here because of Yelp with my boss. Soul rolls for an appetizer were delicious. Corn bread was awesome! Short ribs were perfect and red beans were too. He had Salmon cakes  okra and collard greens with tomatoes. Now  a soul food devotee ! A must in Charlotte!

Oh wow. I came for brunch and made the mistake of not ordering one of their signature soul food dishes. The chicken n dumplings looked amazing, and the fried chicken was outstanding.  Now don't get me wrong, my meat lover omelet was a perfect balance of very pronounced flavors, but there are unique offerings that should be tried if you never have before. The cornbread? Wow.  The biscuits?  Yum.  Sweet tea? But of course. And don't even get me started on the multitude of fresh cobblers and cakes available by the slice... Plus, Bruce Bruce and Anthony Hamilton frequent this place. And if its good enough for Bruce Bruce, its good enough for me. And a friend.

No doubt am I fan. Whether this LBD is craving mac and cheese or collard greens, I know where to go.  I usually order online on "uptown2go", so I know to give it about 20 minutes before collecting my meal. Lately, I have been a huge fan of their bbq sandwich. It comes on top of a buttered roll. Now if that doesn't get it poppin, what does?  Being a northern boy, I never really had the opportunity to munch out on some soul food. Let me tell you, this place has gotten me addicted to collard greens.   They also have good beans and cornbread. And when I want some beans and cornbread, I will go to Mert's for some beans and cornbread. If it wasn't for their beans and cornbread, I'd go somewhere else for my beans and cornbread.  LBD Scale- Easy 8. Now doubt in my mind that this place is a trademark southern soul food boutique. If there's any other places that you recommend, holla at me. But right this second, I'm all about Mert's. I WANT SOME MERT'S IN MY MOUTH!

Sophisticated soul food but great.  Ambiance is classic with a downtown location.  I got the fried chicken, patatoe salad (not traditional but very good) and the collard greens are spectacular with a twist (a little onion and tomatoe on top).

I went to Mert's for lunch based off the reviews here and recommendations from coworkers.  I wasn't disappointed.  Mert's has an atmosphere that is trying to look like a dive diner, but comfortable and clean as well.  The atmosphere works well here.   I ordered the jumbo chicken wings with greens and mac-n-cheese as my sides.  The chicken wings were big and fried crispy, the greens were very tasty as was the mac-n-cheese.  The cornbread has to be some of the best I have ever had.  The greeens and mac-n-cheese were not the best I have ever had, but they were right up towards the top of my list.  The place was fairly busy as I expected and the service was OK.  I recieved my drink and food promptly, but my server never checked back.  I never really needed anything so I didn't suffer, but I can't give 5 stars because of that.  If you like good home cooked goodness then Mert's is the place to go.

I thoroughly enjoyed the cornbread, but my other two companions thought it could have been sweeter.  I ordered salmon cakes, Mac and cheese, and green beens. The greenbeans were over cooked, but the mac and cheese was amazing! The salmon cakes were a little better than ok, I've had better though. Overall I was very stuffed at the end of my meal.  My friend has the soft shell crab po boy with greens and loved it! The greens were cooked perfectly-not overdone.  My wife had the whiting dinner with greens and yams, and loved the fish! She said that the yams had a weird taste-like they added vanilla or something.  From a service perspective, our waitress seemed a bit overwhelmed. She had so many tables! She was moving the best that she could, damn near running.   Overall, my experience was just ok, but nothing memorable. Although nothing was awful, I wouldn't come back.

This was my second visit, the first time I really enjoyed the meal and service. However this last visit will probably be my last. The waitress seem to dislike her job, no smiles she wasn't friendly at all. It was like I was asking for a favor when I asked for a refill on my drink. I came in with my family, and they actually enjoyed their food(fried chicken wings and sides). I wasn't so lucky, I ordered fried pork chop with a side of macaroni and cheese and seasoned rice. The pork chops were very salty and oily, the grease was pouring out each time I cut the meat. I was also give burnt Mac and cheese, I don't mind having my cheese a little burnt but not my pasta. I think Merts is one of those hit or miss type restaurants. It's unfortunate because I love soul food but I would rather cook before I spend money on burnt food with snotty service. What I did enjoy was the cake. Whom ever made the lemon cake hands were touched by God.
I had the blackened salmon, collard greens and yams. The collard greens were cooked  perfectly and the yams were delicious. Blackened salmon was a little overlooked and under seasoned.

EXCELLENT SOUL FOOD!  The fried chicken, Salmon and fried catfish were off the chain!    Service was great...  and all the food including desserts were fresh and home-made!  I left stuffed...  Feeling like I had just spent an afternoon at my sister Gloria's house on Sunday!

I was in town for business, and this "landmark" restaurant was about a block from my hotel. Seeing as a large portion of Charlotte's Uptown restaurants are closed on Sunday, I decided to go against my initial judgment and give this tourist trap a try.  Unfortunately, my instinct was right. The whole meal was off. I ordered the chicken tender plate with green beans and mashed potatoes. The green beans were too sweet, and the mashed potatoes were so under seasoned that they tasted like a pile of mush. I was happy when I saw the chicken tenders once they're hand breaded in house -- that was until I was on my last chicken tender, and it was a piece of fried fish.... This carelessness by the kitchen staff is unacceptable.  The saving grace was the dessert. They have a great cake display, and the cakes are absolutely delicious. The cakes are the only items that reminded me of good ole Southern cooking.

I liked the atmosphere as it was casual and laid back. The service was friendly and courteous too. The prices were reasonable for a place to eat in Uptown that is not a chain. And I like eating at places that are independently owned small businesses. But the food left me only half impressed.   I had the Southern Fried Chicken Breast with Collard Greens and Black Eyed Peas. Unfortunately the Collard Greens was all that I was impressed with. It tasted amazing and topping them with freshly diced onions and tomatoes were a nice touch. But the Fried Chicken and Black Eyed Peas were just EH~. I expected the Fried Chicken to have more flavor. But it didn't. It also tasted too dry and not moist at all. I also expected the Black Eyed Peas to have more flavor or richness to them since they are usually made with bacon or ham hock. But it didn't. And the only thing good about the cornbread, in my opinion, was the honey butter that it came with.   Now I do have to admit it was my first time eating here. And I'm sure there are probably other items on the menu I would have enjoyed just as much as the Collard Greens. But with any restaurant I go to, first impressions matter. My theory is with any good restaurant their entire menu is good no matter what you order, which is what makes me want to go back, make it a favorite destination, and want to keep going back to try EVERYTHING. But I'm going to have to think twice about this place since there was some hits and misses, which is a shame b/c I do love soul food.

I love this. Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. I love how the inside isn't modern but outdated instead; shows some history to the place and a sense of trust. I always get there yams and mac n cheese; soo good. I have had the catfish and whiting, both great.

We went here with some friends after an event. They couldn't believe we hadn't heard of it. Soul Food, sounds good to me! The portions were huge, our waiter was exceptionally nice and patient. Super sweet guy! We all tried different things... the mac was just ok, but the chicken was great. Fried chicken isn't something I usually get, but the fried chicken wings (no sauce on them) were killer. It's such a cool unusual place to visit - you feel like you stepped back in time. I enjoyed it for something new to try.

I really wanted to get grub at Price's, but they don't have a dining area and I didn't want to get take out.  Came here for lunch.  Waitresses was pushing hard on the chicken tenders that she loved.  Free cornbread was average.   I had the fried chicken and sides of mashed potatoes and mac n' cheese.  Surprisingly, none of it was really that good.  Service was cheerful though.  I guess the best part was I was able to park in downtown Charlotte, found a free spot, and wasn't towed when I was done eating here.

Not sure about heart and soul but it was definitely a solid meal.  One thing I really like about this place is the artwork and decor.  They also have outdoor seating on the sidewalk.  I got the beef ribs and dark meat chicken.  Yes it's a lot of food assholes.  And yes I finished it (most of it) but this is 2 hours after having a breakfast buffet at the hotel.  Sides were delish.  I got the yams and okra/tomatoes.

Omg! I came across this place while googling somewhere to eat after a Hornets Game and what a delightful surprise! This is an authentic Southern Restaurant! The atmosphere is extremely comforting and mellow. Our server Jerry was the greatest! He was knowledgeable and very nice. Every suggestion he made was a winner! My girlfriend and I enjoyed whiting,fried chicken  mac and cheese , potato salad, and shrimp and grits , peach cobbler and German chocolate cake !! Everything was cooked to perfection and well seasoned! The true definition of southern cooking and hospitality! A must go to!!

My group of four was seated immediately after walking in, and we were completely done with our entire meal in 25 minutes. We ordered and received our food within 5 minutes of each other. I ordered the southern fried chicken breast with sides of macaroni & cheese and mashed potatoes. The food was incredible! Quality soul food. The restaurant itself is pretty small, but it adds to the overall feel of the place. The atmosphere is very intimate and southern with a home-y feel that everyone can enjoy. I had an incredible experience here and I wish I lived closer so I could come here all the time!!

Great food. The full menu isn't available during CIAA weekend. They only offer a special shortened menu. It's not a problem at all because its super packed in here. The staff  is pretty nice. They can't be too attentive because of how busy they are. It is CIAA weekend so that's understandable.
Insane. Nirvana. Green beans, mac & cheese, cornbread, braised short rib, fried chicken, fish po boy for $28. absolute nails. place is real deal.
I had the veggie plate and they have such pleasant spicy kick in them! Cornbread is just perfect.

Last year I remembered that this place had a line out the door. We waited last year and we waited this year too. Why? Because Mert's is worth it!   We were lined up outside for about 20 minutes this time, but found entertainment in a street hustle, where some character asks to see if you have a 100 dollar bill and if so he invites you to bet it by guessing which of 3 bottle caps has a red pill underneath. I was so glad to get in when we did, really not trying to get caught up in a street brawl just in case both that red pill and main man's 100 dollar bill disappeared all at once.   So we're seated. I ordered a sweet tea, collard greens, mac n cheese, fried catfish, and BBQ beef riblets. Sounds like alot, but the portions are equivalent to a plate of food at a cook out. Nonetheless I was stuffed! The collard greens are excellent, you can taste a little vinegar and they top them with tomato and onion if you don't protest. I enjoyed everything, mac n cheese thick n cheesy, ribs-tender sauce -sweet, the catfish was good n crisp, however I like a slightly spicier batter. But other than that, two thumbs up!!   The surroundings are pleasant, you see lots of young people laughing and having fun, and proud accomplished HBCU alumni telling their stories around the table! An American dream, the culture here is so rich. This place is worthy of a visit from one of those Food Network Road Scholars for sure! Totally SATISFYING; where else can 5 grown ups eat for $80? If yall don't know you better ask somebody :0) Mert's is all that!

Ok, just to dispel any misunderstandings, this isn't true "soul food" - it's great southern cooking.  We have been here three times since living in Charlotte and continue to come back for more. The mac-and-cheese is to die for, and every entree we've had has been terrific. I usually get the fried chicken tenders but opted for the barbecue ribs last time I was here, and was not disappointed. The cornbread is a huge plus but is usually too much for me to finish. Shrimp and Grits is an all-time favorite for me as well. If you can, save room for dessert. If they have it, the german chocolate cake is a total win.  Go for al fresco dining if you can (weather permitting) - nothing like sitting outside and watching the sites of Uptown Charlotte.

Sorry Mert's...just two stars...and I do feel bad. Soul Food is an all time fave for me and I left feeling real let down. Without a doubt, the cornbread is out of this world. But everything else was just 'meh' to me.   I'd actually classify the offerings here more on the cuisine level, than down home comfort food. Down home comfort food is what I was looking for, and sadly I didn't get it at all. I hate to say it but flavor was missing in most of what I tasted. The egg roll appetizers filled with black eyed peas and greens, would have been a total fail had it not been for the dipping sauce. I found the main dish of red beans and rice to be totally lacking in flavor and overall taste appeal. Same went for the collard greens..bland-O.   The restaurant felt good and looked good. The food looked good, but didn't taste good. The service was top notch. Honestly, I'll probably give it another shot in the event it was just an off night.

Came here after they were bookmarked for years on Valentine's Day with a colleague. Now the food wasn't bad to me but it wasn't my taste.   The cornbread mini loaf that was served as an appetizer was delicious! I ordered the catfish with sides of macaroni and cheese, collard greens, and mashed potatoes. I prefer my catfish fried on the harder side and it was served fried a little soft; it became mushy. The collard greens were vinegar based... they were not awful by any means but I have never cared for vinegar based collard greens.   There are a TON of other reviews so I won't go on and on. Due to my personal preferences of liking sweet collards versus bitter and catfish fried hard, my meal wasn't that enjoyable. I'm definitely glad that I did check it out for the experience.

The most southern style food and restaurant you can find in Charlotte. Fried catfish was good but their chicken was average.   When I first started working in Charlotte, three months ago, everyone raved about Mert's. So as a "New York city-slicker" I got dragged by my coworkers to try "southern cookin".   Nothing super about the food, but the sides are amazing. Mmmmmm cornbread

Best fried chicken I have ever had.  Looking for good southern, soul food?  You have come to the right place!  Their cornbread alone could keep them in business.  Wait staff is friendly and attentive.  Greens, Mac n cheese, fried fish.... all delicious.

The family and I went here over the weekend after a long day at the Strawberry Festival. I had been wanting to eat here for years, especially after seeing them on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives. I'm such a foodie so I love trying new places.  Hate that we had to pay to park, but that's the downside to eating somewhere in the city. It was a beautiful night and we got to eat out front. Food was GREAT. Service, not so much. We were seated before another table, and they were greeted and brought drinks out to. I had to get up after about 10 minutes of sitting there and ask if we had a server. The hostess said our server was busy so she'd take our drink order. Right after that, he came over to our table and got our order.  First, they bring out the cornbread. Omg! Best freakin cornbread I've ever had in my life!! It was so moist and just absolutely delicious. I ordered fried chicken, bbq beef ribs, mac n cheese, and green beans. The fried chicken was a little disappointing as I anticipated it to have more flavor than it did. It was kind of bland. The ribs were decent, a little too fatty but that is to be expected. Mac n cheese was off the chain. Green beans were just that, nothing special. My son had green beans, mac n cheese, and homefries. He didn't care for the homefries cause they were more like sautéed potatoes and he prefers fries. My husband had the shrimp po'boy and homefries. He said his was good.  Our drinks stayed empty for the most part so service needs to be better. We left an 18% tip (he's lucky he got that), and the server picked the receipt up before we left and had an ugly look on his face like we didn't leave enough. Sorry, next time you should pay more attention to your tables. They weren't that busy. There were plenty of empty tables.   All in all, it was a nice family dinner in the city. Wasn't even too expensive (about the price you'd pay at Chili's). Not sure we'll be back, but it was a good experience.

I've eaten at Merts a few times and even received a free birthday meal which included a drink. Very impressed. My favorite dishes are the salmon cakes and the rice and beans with turkey sausage but that dish tends to be too salty at times. Overall, nice place to eat.
This is a great place. It is a little pricey, but we enjoyed the food! The service was just ok, not great. We will definitely go back when we are in Charlotte again.

The service was good but idk what the hype is about this place... food is gross! Not good southern food! No seasoning on the food what so ever and our corn bread wasn't done I've been twice and haven't had a good experience. My shrimp and grits was soup literally

This spot is a must go to whenever I'm in Charlotte. The mac&cheese is sooo good. And i just had the soft crab po boy and it was awesome!!! Shrimp and grits are a favorite though i must admit they weren't as good this time as the last, but still good nonetheless.

Best soul food I've ever eaten. I love this place sooo much!!! It's always packed no matter what time I'm there. Food comes out fast and very hot. If I could eat there every day, I would! Best salmon cakes around.

First time for 6 of us.   Enjoyed the shrimp and grits, salmon cakes and the cornbread. The cornbread was killer as was the potato cake. Apparently the secret to the cornbread is honey and mayonnaise. They are worth the trip themselves.   Fried chicken was crispy and Moist. Collard greens were great. Candied yams and coleslaw were not good.   Service was great. Server shaniq was very fun and pleasant, however Hostess was not as friendly.   Atmoshpere was definitely a greasy spoon, diner style. Don't have the craving to go back

Serviceable food. I'm not sure how authentic this is and seems geared to Uptown tourists. Had red beans and rice with turkey sausage. Really needed a kick. Hate to say this but the red beans and rice is tastier at Popeyes Chicken. My side of collard greens was just ok...but my okra and tomatoes side was tasty. Best part of dinner was the sweet potato cake!  Service was good and atmosphere was pleasant. Reasonable prices.

Man, I've had this place bookmarked almost since I first found Yelp in Charlotte. I've just never had an opportunity to eat here until I had some friends staying in Uptown and they wanted a "Charlotte meal". So here's to Mert's and one less bookmark!  Classic Southern soul food. Collard greens and fried okra and fried chicken and sausage gravy and all those yummy things that just put weight on when you mention their names! I was tempted by so much but when the waiter mentioned their specials, I knew that the grilled pork chop in white gravy was for me. And it was. Excellent and tasty with lots of flavor and spice, I cleaned the plate and then picked up the bone for chewing. Great stuff. For sides, I had the mac & cheese (excellent!) and the yams (only meh).  For dessert, the peach cobbler was only okay - an overwheming spiciness. I think that I might have just gotten a bad scoop, because my friend who had it really liked his. The vanilla ice cream gave it the right consistency, but the flavor wasn't right.  Street parking only, but it's barely a stone's throw from the LYNX Station so consider taking the train!

Excellent experience all around.  - Service was great.  Friendly, warm and this is why I love visiting the South. - Food was excellent.   Someone told me that the cornbread was out of this world.  Yup it is.   We had the fried chicken (cooked to perfection), collards, yams and my favorite was the mac and cheese.  Sweet tea was amazing. - The play some nice music while you're eating and it's just a fun spot.
Amazing food, never disappointed!! If your going to the spectrum center be sure to hit this place up!  Cornbread is on another level and you better bring your appetite, always leave stuffed!!
The food is good but the waiters are money hungry only ppl they want to wait on are ppl they think they will get a Big tip from ,,. Sad  aka old white ppl , black ppl have money too

Southern soul food...what else is there!?! Everything sounds good, but went for the day special..braised pork steak with white wine sauce with my choice of 2 sides..Greens done right and okra with tomatoes...yum yum yum.  Meals come with a mini cornbread loaf and honey butter..OMG tasty!!  Didn't have room to try one of several delicious looking cakes under domes    I will definitely be back when in CLT!!

Had the BBQ beef ribs, fried catfish with the 2 sides and corn bread. My two sides were potato salad and yams. The sides were GREAT. So was the corn bread. The beef ribs were not FULL ribs. The ribs were like riblets. It was only bone. We complained and our server looked out. We were upset that the riblets were so small and it doesn't say riblets on the menu. It says BBQ RIBS. Other than that, the food was amazing even the riblets.
Best place in charlotte to get a taste of  southern food..we had fried chicken, salmon cakes, collard greens , beans , corn bread, mac and cheese ..everything was amazing..

Charlotte is an odd city. It appears as if North Carolina needed a place to conduct financial business and girls, wearing the tightest/shortest skirts I have ever seen, needed a place to congregate. Men wearing colorful polo shirts, short pleated shorts and Italian loafers with no socks needed a place to make money and look for the short skirt women.   The whole city shuts down Saturday and Sunday except for bars and restaurants during the PM hours. Finding a good breakfast place seemed like a daunting task until we found Mert's.  This cozy soul food joint had tons of character and a solid menu. When we walked in, the smell of fried chicken and greens slam you in the face. There were two pots large enough to bath William Howard Taft slowly cooking collard greens on the stove in the back. The griddle was loaded up with bacon and pancakes. Just a beautiful sight.   I ordered eggs and country ham with home fries and a biscuit. The biscuit was so good i almost ordered another. Instead, i just ate most of my wife's. I also got a pan cake on the side. I honestly dont remember eating a better pancake in years. Lastly, i ordered fried green tomatoes. Very well done. Batter was a little hard but all in all, very good. Also, the tomatoes taste like they spent some time in the fridge.  My wife got the sweet potato pan cakes as well as fried chicken and eggs. The fried chicken was shockingly good. I could have gone back that night to eat more.  The only down side was all the eggs served to our table were under cooked. When i order over easy, i expect to have all the white cooked with a runny yolk. We all ordered over easy and there was a lot of uncooked egg white in everyone's eggs. There is a simple fix for this: order over medium!  Coffee was nice a strong. Syrup was hot. Hot sauce was already on the table. Real butter was served.
Would've loved to have tried your food but I stood at the front for 10 minutes and no one greeted me. Maybe next time?
This place is really good.  The staff was great, food fresh, and a great menu.    I will always return whenever in Downtown.

never had anything from here that wasnt absolutely delish! fried chicken is outstanding, like grandma made it. salmon cakes and cornbread, some of the best ive ever had. greens are so good. mac and cheese rivals my grandmothers recipe. banana pudding and sweet potato cake are my favorite desserts here, but honestly you can get anything and you cant go wrong. dont forget to try the soul rolls as an appetizer. so good!! i love this place. i took my family that lives in hawaii here and my bro said that this might be his favorite place to eat anywhere. its one of my favorites too :)

The place is extremely over-rated.  I have been there multiple times and after this last visit I will never spend my money there again. After being sat we were ignored for a good 10-15 minutes, meanwhile we got water spilled on us and still no service.  We then had to get up and ask someone to serve us.  Their greens are lacking flavor and are somewhat toothy.  Their "famous" shrimp and grits are mediocre at best.  The po-boy was a huge piece of bread with literally 5 shrimp on it for almost 12 bucks, and came about 7 minutes after everyone else's food (supposedly they were "adding more shrimp" LMAO!) Their cornbread is legit though, I will give them that.  Sadly good cornbread isn't enough to make up for their lack of caring, it shows in their food and service.  Guy Fieri's taste buds are seriously off, the bleach is getting to his brain.  Adios Merts.

We've been living in Charlotte for a year now, and we've been to quite a few restaurants in our time. However, while I have found that perfect BBQ joint I dreamed of, I had not yet happened across the quintessential place for good ol' Southern cooking...in particular fried chicken. Well, that is now a thing of the past, for I have found Merts.  You could tell just from walking inside that it was going to be a great Southern food experience. The interior of the restaurant is colorful and eye-catching, and the art and decor screams Southern. The interior was full to capacity, but we were able to snag a table outside. The outdoor area is a mixed bag. While it's nowhere near as crowded as inside (with only four tables or so) the Charlotte pedestrians take it upon themselves to walk through the outdoor area. It was a bit disruptive to be eating a nice meal while people constantly walked right against your table.   I wasn't a fan of the beer list since Merts does not carry any drafts, so I stuck with unsweet tea. After placing our orders the server came over with a small loaf of cornbread for each of us. This cornbread was spot on for me! Not gritty, a little sweet and extremely crumbly. You could tell it was fresh from the oven, and that made it super awesome!  For dinner I ordered the beef ribs and leg quarter fried chicken combo. I wasn't crazy about the ribs themselves, as they were a bit tough and chunks of bone kept flaking off. I did enjoy the sauce, as it was a sweet and tangy sauce and not vinegary. Now the chicken was THE BOMB! I've been searching for fried chicken down here, and have been disappointed time and again. So far I am confident to say that Merts has the best fried chicken (though I haven't made it over to Price's yet, so don't jump on me for that yet.) The battered skin was light and crisp, and not greasy. The interior was that moist and juicy you expect from fried chicken. I was in heaven scoffing that chicken down, and I wish I had more right now!   The miss' ordered the catfish and fried chicken breast combo, and that was also pretty dang awesome. The catfish was a huge filet just plopped on the plate. The meat came right off and was so light and tasty. The batter was also perfect, with not too much that didn't take away from the soft flavor of the fish. They serve it with this spicy sauce that was a good compliment to the fish. The chicken breast was just as good as my leg. Even the white meat stayed juicy and tender! The miss' didn't eat too much of it after filling up on the fish, so there are plenty of chicken leftovers in my future!  The other thing that Merts does damn good is sides. One problem I've had at BBQ and other places down here is that the meats are perfect, yet the sides are extremely lacking. Merts has some of the best dang sides money can buy. We both ordered the mac & cheese and it was simply the best I've had down here. Some places I've been to make it watery or oily or just not flavored right, but Merts had it all. It was a firm consistency with a great cheesy flavor, and the cheese crust on top was awesome. I also tried black eyed peas for the first time and loved them. They were cooked perfectly and were served in this kind of gravy that was also tasty. The miss' ordered the collard greens and I have to say that I liked those too. I'm generally not a fan of collards as they are bitter, but these were cooked in such a way that the bitterness was taken down a notch or two. They had some citrus flavoring to them that helped tone it down and added a different level of flavor to. All in all, the sides kicked butt! Unfortunately we were so stuffed from this massive meal that we did not stick around for dessert.  I have to say, when I think home cooked Southern fare, I will always associate it with Merts. They can fry up some mean chicken and fish, and their sides and veggies are top notch. It's a busy place but it is definitely worth the trip.

We've had the pleasure of experiencing Mert's dine in and takeout. I must say, I definitely recommend dine in over takeout. The quality of the entree is very inconsistent. We tried takeout first, I got the salmon salmon cake entree while the bf ordered the fried chicken plate. We got the mac and cheese, red bean, and mashed potato side. It took FOREVER TO PICK UP, and we even arrived 15 minutes after they said it was ready. I was waiting at the cashier stand for another 15-20 minutes. Upon arriving back home, I was sad to find that my salmon cakes were not as large or fluffy as depicted on the groupon picture or the dine in pictures on Yelp. They tasted great tho, the remoulade was flavorful and paired well for this meal. The mac and cheese was our favorite side, followed by the creamy mashed potatoes (made out of red potatoes for a twist). The red beans didn't have that much flavor. However, the sides were not as large as I had hoped. The cornbread was sooo good! I read on the website the moisture comes from some mayo  added to the mix. Overall good quality, I just expected more food, it didn't even cover half of the tin takeout tray that it was served in.   Fast forward to last week, this time we got the dine in groupon. Luckily, not nearly as crowded as it was the first time I walked in. I ordered the exact same thing while the bf got a chicken po boy and some home fries. This time, the salmon patties were a good size but, did not taste as good as the takeout I had earlier. It almost seemed as if it were canned tune, did not have the consistency of a home cooked patty...unless it spent an hour in the food processor. The sides were good as before. The bf's po boy was huge and stuffed with fresh chicken tenders. I thought it needed some more remoulade, it was a little dry but, tasty and hearty.   I want to come back here again, but it is a hit or a miss. I would stick to dine in if I were you. Cheers!

Walked in and was warmly greeted.  Exceptional customer service by an amazing young lady.  The food was quick and great.  Nice clean restaurant that is reasonably priced.  Overall phenomenal experience.  Highly recommend this spot for all visitors.

Oh man. When people talk about legit southern food, I will think of this place fondly. I will actually probably think of it and drool.   I ordered the special turkey dinner, with greens and Mac n' cheese. I didn't even realize the turkey had stuffing in it! Both were incredible! I also absolutely loved the greens and Mac. Honestly, I wish I had a bottomless stomach so I could have eaten it all. One thing's for sure, and it's that you will not leave hungry!
The food really is some of the best soul food I've ever had. I tried some of everyone's sides and each was legit. I had the special, spicy ribs with green beans and rice, and I licked my plate clean

Did you ever feel like you've been catfished by a restaurant? Not in the good way, where you eat some delicious catfish, but where the online photos and experience are NOTHING like what you encounter in person? This restaurant embodies that experience so perfectly I'm surprised they aren't claiming they're a model or a rapper that just needs to borrow a few hundred dollars.   Ambience: Casual, with a regular serving of insects. I can understand the flies since there was an oddly placed lamp beside us, but I also had to kill a silverfish on the menu, a tiny roach at the end of dinner and some random bug that crawled on my cleavage at the end of dinner. If I had seen the roach earlier in the night I could have avoided this catastrophe.  Drinks: Insultingly subpar. If your mimosas have as much alcohol as a glass of Kool aid then you need to start over. You can buy better champagne from a 7-11 if they sell it in your state.  Food: Dreadful. We got the soul food sampler so we could try everything, in addition to the shrimp Creole and a side of mac and cheese. The salmon cakes were okay, that's the nicest thing I can say about them. The wings had zero seasoning- the best thing I can say about them is they weren't raw. The soul roll was an abomination of grease and tastelessness, and should be removed from the menu immediately. The mac and cheese tasted more sad than a kindergartner's Kraft cheese and macaroni. There were no curds or any indication that any skill was involved here. I assume this was the cook's first time in the kitchen- it was a 1 cheese crime against soul food. It earned a solid F. The shrimp Creole there's no excuse for. OPEN A BOX OF ZATARAIN'S IF YOU CARE THIS LITTLE.  Staff: Lovely! The only bright spot in an otherwise demoralizing evening out. She was a sweetheart and deserved every penny of the tip she got. I'm serious, she was great!   Overall: Just go to McDonald's and get their breakfast menu items. As a person who easily skips McDs for years at a time this is saying a lot. But if you're yearning for terrible food you should at least save money while you're at it.  RUN!

Highly, highly overrated! I'm from Louisiana, so I'm a tough critic. I ordered Blackened Pork Chops and it was just okay. Also, we smelled like a grease kitchen for the rest of the day. Best advice is to dine outside! Best piece of lunch was the cornbread.

Mert's was an interesting introduction to soul food.  We ordered sweet tea, salmon cakes with collard greens and black-eyed peas, fried chicken (dark) with collard greens and rice and fried catfish with okra and steamed cabbage.    Before all the food came out, the plate of 3 hot and piping corn breads were served with butter.  Very fresh, right out of the oven.  Don't eat too much of this corn bread or you won't be able to finish your meal.  The salmon cakes came with a spicy aioli - very tasty salmon cakes and I like the aioli.    The fried chicken was darn good!  The fried catfish - even better!  No fishy smell.  Just fresh catfish with that nice spicy aioli.  Collard Greens, Black-Eyed Peas, Okra, Steamed Cabbage - all good!  No room for dessert after lunch but I understand that there's 13 varieties of cake to choose from!
Chopped pork, corn bread, soul roll, blacked chop Delicious.  Agree greens a bit stemy but still good. Strawberry cake fair banana pudding eh. I'd go back!

The best fried catfish filets I've ever had. Also got the yams (unbelievably good) and creamy cole slaw. All that and 5-star cornbread. Must have been 2 inches thick and light as a feather. This was truly phenomenal home cooking. I told the boss she could charge 2-3 times the price in San Antonio and pack the dining room.

I came to Charlotte on a mini vacation for a week. People around the area were raving about this place called Mert's.  I decided to check out this place for dinner. When I walked in, I felt like I was at home.   Everything felt laid back and homey. I didn't know what to order so I decided to ask the waitress. She gave me a couple recommendations and I decided to go with the combo which came with BBQ Beef Rib, Fried Chicken, and two sides. I ordered the Mac & Cheese and home fries. Blue Moon was only $3.50 so we decided to grab couple beers.  While we waited for our food our waitress came to our table with some corn bread and sweet butter. This is probably the best cornbread I ever had!!! It was sweet and delicious!!! When my food came the Fried Chicken looked dry and not very appealing. I bite into the chicken and was amazed! The chicken was juicy, tender, and not that greasy! The beef ribs were just as satisfying!  The mac & cheese and mash potatoes were both great.   I would definitely recommend this place. The atmosphere was relaxing and I felt like I was at home. Waitress provided excellent service and was conversing with us throughout the night. Lastly, the combo with the two sides cost me $14! If you are near downtown Charlotte, you must check this place out and order the FRIED CHICKEN & BBQ RIBS!

Heard great things before going here, so I was glad to get one of those half off deals that we could go try it.  We were greeted nicely by a young lady at the desk who offered to seat us in the half empty restaurant (it was about 7:45pm on a Wednesday) directly under the flat screen TV that was blaring so loudly that we could not have heard each other.  We asked if we could be seated away from the TV but were only offered two tables, both of which were only one away from the one under the TV and there were others available further away.      We were greeted by a server that we thought was ours who asked for our drink order and he promptly got those for us and disappeared.  After several minutes, the young lady who seated us eventually came to the table and said she was our server.  She told us the specials of the night and then said unless we wanted to put in an order for an appetizer, she would be back after she put in two other orders.  It took her another 5-8 minutes to return and take our order.        Thankfully, the food didn't take as long as the ordering process did, but the server was was a bit short with me when she seemed unsure as to which plate went to whom.  After our food came, she was mostly unavailable, never offered to refill drinks, and when our 12 year old politely asked for her assistance as she passed by, she said she would be right back but didn't return for another 8 minutes or so.  The restaurant was not incredibly busy and there were 3 other servers, one of whom was on a laptop at the bar for at least 30 min. and then stood watching the TV instead of helping other servers or checking on tables.        As for the food:  Cornbread = one the best I've had.  I'm NC native.  Lived here all my life...I know cornbread.  Our youngest got the yams and a BBQ pork sandwich, both of which were very tasty...especially the pork.  Our oldest got the chicken fingers, home fries and macaroni and cheese.  He loved the mac...ordered more.  Home fries were more like potato wedges tossed with spices.  Flavor was ok, but the potatoes were dry and unimpressive.  He enjoyed the chicken fingers but didn't rave about them.  I got a veggie plate with mashed potatoes, collard greens, black-eyed peas, and a salad.  The salad consisted on one red onion slice, one cucumber slice and shredded mixed greens.  The honey mustard dressing seemed like a bottled one, though it tasted ok.  This served on a small saucer.  The black-eyed peas were good properly, but a bit bland.  The mashed potatoes were flecked with bit of the skins and had good flavor overall, but nothing exceptional.  The collards were the real star; salty, tender green goodness.  My husband got the red beans which he said were just okay, He also got the house fries, which he didn't care for, and the collards (he liked, but says his mom makes better...true,) the seasoned rice (meh) and the salad.  Nothing memorable.      We probably will not return mostly based on the inattentive service and hit or miss food.   .
Definitely hidden. They serve good brunch on the weekends and you won't wait in a ridiculous line full of degenerates.   Make sure to get their biscuits.

Okay. So I don't see the hoopla about this place.  We had salmon cakes, I had the pork chops, okra, and the green beans. My dish was pretty simple in taste.
